"[276-uncle salters] said [poor Salters]276-uncle salters , as [the schooner]553-the schooner swung up . [She]553-the schooner might have been [the very Flying Dutchman , so foul , draggled , and unkempt was every rope and stick aboard]884-the very flying dutchman , so foul , draggled , and unkempt was every rope and stick aboard . [Her]553-the schooner old - style quarterdeck was some or five feet high , and [her]553-the schooner rigging flew knotted and tangled like weed at [a wharf - end]885-a wharf - end . [She]553-the schooner was running before the wind - yawing frightfully - [her]553-the schooner staysail let down to act as a sort of extra foresail , - ' scandalized , " [they]2329-they call it , - and [her]553-the schooner foreboom guyed out over the side . [Her]553-the schooner bowsprit cocked up like an old - fashioned frigate 's ; [her]553-the schooner jib - boom had been fished and spliced and nailed and clamped beyond further repair ; and as [she]553-the schooner hove [herself]553-the schooner forward , and sat down on [her]553-the schooner broad tail , [she]553-the schooner looked for all [the world]653-the world like [a blouzy , frouzy , bad old woman sneering at [a decent girl]2332-a decent girl]2331-a blouzy , frouzy , bad old woman sneering at a decent girl . "[553-the schooner] That 's Abishal , " said [Salters]276-uncle salters . "[553-the schooner] Full o ' gin an ' [Judique men]886-judique men , an ' the judgments o ' [Providence]21-providence layin ' fer [him]887-he an ' never takin ' good holt [He]887-he 's run in to bait , Miquelon way . " "[887-he] [He]887-he 'll run [her]553-the schooner under , " said [Long Jack]273-long jack . "[887-he] That 's no rig fer this weather . " "[887-he] Not [he]887-he , ' r he'd'a done it long ago , " [Disko]263-disko replied . "[887-he] Looks 's if [he]887-he cal'lated to run [us]888-us under . Ai n't [she]553-the schooner daown by the head more ' n natural , [Tom Platt]274-tom platt ? " "[274-tom platt] Ef it 's [his]887-he style o ' loadin ' [her]553-the schooner [she]553-the schooner ai n't safe , " said [the sailor]2333-the sailor slowly . "[553-the schooner] Ef [she]553-the schooner 's spewed [her]553-the schooner oakum [he]887-he 'd better git to [his]887-he pumps mighty quick . " [The creature]2334-the creature threshed up , wore round with a clatter and raffle , and lay head to wind within ear - shot . A gray - beard wagged over [the bulwark]2335-the bulwark , and a thick voice yelled something [Harvey]250-harvey could not understand . But [Disko]263-disko 's face darkened . "[887-he] [He]887-he 'd resk every stick [he]887-he [hez]887-he to carry bad news . Says [we]888-us 're in fer a shift o ' wind . [He]887-he 's in fer worse . [Abishal]342-abishal ! Abi - shal ! " [He]887-he waved [his]887-he arm up and down with the gesture of [a man at the pumps]2336-a man at the pumps , and pointed forward . [The crew]728-the crew mocked [him]887-he and laughed . "[889-ye] Jounce [ye]889-ye , an ' strip [ye]889-ye an ' trip [ye]889-ye ! " yelled [Uncle Abishal]342-abishal . "[890-a livin ' gale] [A livin ' gale]890-a livin ' gale - [a livin ' gale]890-a livin ' gale . Yab ! Cast up fer [your]889-ye last trip , all [you]889-ye [Gloucester]19-gloucester haddocks . [You]889-ye wo n't see [Gloucester]19-gloucester no more , no more ! " "[889-ye] Crazy full - as usual , " said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . "[889-ye] Wish [he]887-he had n't spied [us]892-us , though . " [She]893-she drifted out of hearing while [the gray - head]2338-the gray - head yelled something about a dance at [the Bay of [Bulls]343-bulls]2339-the bay of bulls and [a dead man in the foc'sle]2340-a dead man in the foc'sle . [Harvey]250-harvey shuddered . [He]250-harvey had seen [the sloven tilled decks]2341-the sloven tilled decks and [the savage - eyed crew]2342-the savage - eyed crew . "[887-he] An ' that 's a fine little floatin ' hell fer [her]893-she draught , " said [Long Jack]273-long jack . "[0-i] [I]0-i wondher what mischief [he]887-he 's been at [ashore]2232-ashore . " "[887-he] [He]887-he 's [a trawler]895-a trawler , " [Dan]260-dan explained to [Harvey]250-harvey , "[887-he] an ' [he]887-he runs in fer bait all along [the coast]859-the coast . Oh , no , not [home]545-home , [he]887-he do n't go . [He]887-he deals along [the south]898-the south an ' [east shore]899-east shore up yonder . " [He]260-dan nodded in the direction of [the pitiless Newfoundland beaches]2343-the pitiless newfoundland beaches . "[259-dad] [Dad]259-dad wo n't never take [me]0-i ashore there . [They]900-they 're [a mighty tough crowd]901-a mighty tough crowd - an ' [Abishal]342-abishal 's the toughest . [You]902-you saw [[his]342-abishal boat]903-his boat ? Well , [she]903-his boat 's nigh seventy year old , [they]900-they say ; [the last o ' the old Marblehead heel - tappers]904-the last o ' the old marblehead heel - tappers . " "[0-i] ' Twon't be any use underrunnin ' the trawl to - night , " said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt , with quiet despair . "[342-abishal] [He]342-abishal come alongside special to cuss [us]907-we . " [The disheveled "[344-sam mocatta] heel - tapper]2344-the disheveled " heel - tapper " danced drunkenly down wind , and all eyes followed [her]2344-the disheveled " heel - tapper . Suddenly [the cook]628-the cook cried in [his]628-the cook phonograph voice : "[342-abishal] It wass [his]342-abishal own death made [him]342-abishal speak so ! [He]342-abishal iss [fey - fey]910-fey - fey , [I]0-i tell [you]911-you ! Look ! " [She]2344-the disheveled " heel - tapper sailed into a patch of watery sunshine three or four miles distant . [The patch]2346-the patch dulled and faded out , and even as the light passed so did [the schooner]553-the schooner . [She]2344-the disheveled " heel - tapper dropped into a hollow and - was not . "[0-i] Run under , by [the Great Hook - Block]912-the great hook - block ! " shouted [Disko]263-disko , jumping aft . "[0-i] Drunk or sober , [we]907-we 've got to help ['em]913-her . Heave short and break [her]913-her out ! Smart ! " [Harvey]250-harvey was thrown on [the deck]517-the deck by the shock that followed the setting of the jib and foresail , for [they]907-we hove short on the cable , and to save time , jerked the anchor bodily from the bottom , heaving in as [they]907-we moved away . This is a bit of brute force seldom resorted to except in matters of life and death , and the little ' [We]907-we 're Here ' complained like [a human]2349-a human . [They]907-we ran down to where [Abishal]342-abishal 's craft had vanished ; found two or three trawl - tubs , a gin - bottle , and a stove - in dory , but nothing more . "[907-we] Let ['em]907-we go , " said [Disko]263-disko , though [no one]1898-no one had hinted at picking [them]907-we up . "[921-you] If [you]921-you runna that way before the ' wind , and [she]922-she work open [her]922-she seams - " [He]272-manuel threw out [his]272-manuel hands with an indescribable gesture , while [Penn]284-penn sat down on [the house]736-the house and sobbed at the sheer horror and pity of it all . [Harvey]250-harvey could not realize that [he]250-harvey had seen death on [the open waters]2353-the open waters , but [he]250-harvey felt very sick . Then [Dan]260-dan went up the cross - trees , and [Disko]263-disko steered [them]907-we back to within sight of [their]907-we own trawl - buoys just before the fog blanketed [the sea]1855-the sea once again . "[922-she] [We]907-we go mighty quick hereabouts when [we]907-we do go , " was all [he]263-disko said to [Harvey]250-harvey . "[922-she] [You]921-you think on that fer a spell , [young feller]1873-young feller . That was liquor . " "[276-uncle salters] After dinner it was calm enough to fish from [the decks]924-the decks , - [Penn]284-penn and [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters were very zealous this time , - and the catch was large and large fish . " [Abishal]342-abishal has shorely took [his]342-abishal luck with [him]342-abishal , "[276-uncle salters] said [Salters]276-uncle salters . " The wind hain't backed ner riz ner nothin' . How abaout the trawl ? [I]276-uncle salters despise superstition , anyway . "[276-uncle salters] [Tom Platt]274-tom platt insisted that [they]907-we had much better haul the thing and make a new berth . But [the cook]628-the cook said : " The luck iss in two pieces . [You]1873-young feller will find it so when [you]1873-young feller look . [I]628-the cook know . "[628-the cook] This so tickled [Long Jack]273-long jack that [he]273-long jack overbore [Tom Platt]274-tom platt and [the two]926-the two went out together . Underrunning a trawl means pulling it in on one side of [the dory]520-the dory , picking off the fish , rebaiting the hooks , and passing them back to [the sea]1855-the sea again - something like pinning and unpinning linen on a wash - line . It is a lengthy business and rather dangerous , for the long , sagging line may twitch [a boat]2002-a boat under in a flash . But when [they]907-we heard , " And naow to [thee]1873-young feller , O Capting , "[274-tom platt] booming out of the fog , [the crew of the ' [We]907-we 're Here]930-the crew of the ' we 're here ' took heart . [The dory]520-the dory swirled alongside well loaded , [Tom Platt]274-tom platt yelling for [Manuel]272-manuel to act as [relief - boat]932-relief - boat . " The luck 's cut square in two pieces , "[273-long jack] said [Long Jack]273-long jack , forking in the fish , while [Harvey]250-harvey stood open - mouthed at the skill with which [the plunging dory]933-the plunging dory was saved from destruction . " [One half]2355-one half was [jest punkins]2356-jest punkins . [Tom Platt]274-tom platt wanted to haul [her]2355-one half an ' ha ' done wid ut ; but [I]250-harvey said , "[250-harvey] [I]0-i 'll back [the doctor]2318-the doctor that has the second sight , an ' the other half come up sagging full o ' big uns . Hurry , [Man'nle]935-man'nle , an ' bring 's a tub o ' bait . There 's luck afloat to - night . " The fish bit at the newly baited hooks from which [[their]907-we brethren]2357-their brethren had just been taken , and [Tom Platt]274-tom platt and [Long Jack]273-long jack moved methodically up and down the length of [the trawl]2358-the trawl , the boat 's nose surging under the wet line of hooks , stripping the sea - cucumbers that [they]907-we called pumpkins , slatting off the fresh - caught cod against the gunwale , rebaiting , and loading [Manuel]272-manuel 's dory till dusk . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll take no risks , " said [Disko]263-disko then - "[0-i] not with [him]936-she floatin ' around so near . [Abishal]342-abishal wo n't sink fer a week . [Heave]937-heave in the dories an ' [we]938-we 'll dress daown after supper . " That was a mighty dressing - down , attended by three or four blowing grampuses . It lasted till nine o'clock , and [Disko]263-disko was thrice heard to chuckle as [Harvey]250-harvey pitched the split fish into the hold . "[937-heave] Say , [you]935-man'nle 're haulin ' ahead dretful fast , " said [Dan]260-dan , when [they]907-we ground the knives after [the men]1868-the men had turned in . "[935-man'nle] There 's somethin' of [a sea]878-a sea to - night , an ' [I]0-i hain't heard [you]935-man'nle make no remarks on it . " "[935-man'nle] Too busy , " [Harvey]250-harvey replied , testing a blade 's edge . "[935-man'nle] Come to think of it , [she]936-she is a high - kicker . " The little schooner was gambolling all around [her]936-she anchor among the silver - tipped waves . Backing with a start of affected surprise at the sight of the strained cable , [she]936-she pounced on it like a kitten , while the spray of [her]936-she descent burst through the hawse - holes with the report of a gun . Shaking [her]936-she head , [she]936-she would say : "[936-she] Well , [I]0-i 'm sorry [I]0-i ca n't stay any longer with [you]935-man'nle . [I]0-i 'm going [North]940-north , " and would sidle off , halting suddenly with a dramatic rattle of [her]936-she rigging . "[0-i] As [I]0-i was just going to observe , " [she]936-she would begin , as gravely as [a drunken man addressing a lamp - post]2360-a drunken man addressing a lamp - post . The rest of the sentence [she]936-she acted [her]936-she words in dumb - show , of course was lost in a fit of the fidgets , when [she]936-she behaved like a puppy chewing a string , [a clumsy woman in a side - saddle]2361-a clumsy woman in a side - saddle , a hen with [her]941-her head cut off , or a cow stung by a hornet , exactly as the whims of [the sea]1855-the sea took [her]936-she . "[941-her] See [her]941-her sayin ' [her]941-her piece . [She]941-her 's [Patrick Henry]347-patrick henry naow , " said [Dan]260-dan . [She]936-she swung sideways on a roller , and gesticulated with [her]936-she jib - boom from port to starboard . "[941-her] But - ez - fer [me]0-i , give [me]0-i liberty - er give [me]0-i - death ! " Wop ! [She]936-she sat down in the moon - path on [the water]585-the water , courtesying with a flourish of pride impressive enough had not the wheel - gear sniggered mockingly in its box . [Harvey]250-harvey laughed aloud . "[941-her] Why , it 's just as if [she]941-her was alive , " [he]250-harvey said . "[941-her] [She]941-her 's as stiddy as [a haouse an ' as dry as a herrin ']942-a haouse an ' as dry as a herrin ' , " said [Dan]260-dan enthusiastically , as [he]260-dan was slung across [the deck]517-the deck in a batter of spray . "[941-her] Fends 'em off an ' fends 'em off , an ' ' Do n't [ye]943-ye come anigh [me]0-i , ' [she]941-her sez . Look at [her]941-her - jest look at [her]941-her ! Sakes ! [You]943-ye should see one o ' [them]944-them toothpicks histin ' up [her]941-her anchor on [[her]941-her spike outer fifteen - fathom water]945-her spike outer fifteen - fathom water . " "[941-her] What 's a toothpick , [Dan]260-dan ? " "[944-them] [Them]944-them new haddockers an ' herrin'-boats . Fine 's [a yacht]946-a yacht forward , with [yacht sterns]947-yacht sterns to 'em , an ' spike bowsprits , an ' a haouse that ' u'd take [our]948-our hold . [Dad]259-dad can find fish , but [he]259-dad ai n't no ways progressive - [he]259-dad do n't go with the march o ' the times . " "[260-dan] Hills o ' dollars . Fifteen thousand , p'haps ; more , [mebbe]2083-mebbe . There 's gold - leaf an ' everything [you]260-dan kin think of . " Then to [himself]0-i , half under [his]0-i breath , "[260-dan] Guess [I]0-i 'd call [her]949-the elector o ' gloucester [Hattie]294-hattie S. , too . " [CHAPTER V]349-chapter v That was the first of many talks with [Dan]260-dan , who told [Harvey]250-harvey why [he]260-dan would transfer [his]260-dan dory 's name to the imaginary [Burgess - modelled haddocker]348-burgess . [Harvey]250-harvey heard a good deal about the real [Hattie]294-hattie at [Gloucester]19-gloucester ; saw a lock of [her]294-hattie hair - which [Dan]260-dan , finding fair words of no avail , had "[949-the elector o ' gloucester] hooked " as [she]294-hattie sat in front of [him]260-dan at [school]2284-school that winter - and a photograph . [Hattie]294-hattie was about fourteen years old , with an awful contempt for [boys]2074-boys , and had been trampling on [Dan]260-dan 's heart through the winter . All this was revealed under oath of solemn secrecy on [moonlit decks]2367-moonlit decks , in the dead dark , or in choking fog ; the whining wheel behind [them]2074-boys , the climbing deck before , and without , [the unresting , clamorous sea]2368-the unresting , clamorous sea . Once , of course , as [the boys]703-the boys came to know [each other]2370-each other , there was a fight , which raged from bow to stern till [Penn]284-penn came up and separated [them]703-the boys , but promised not to tell [Disko]263-disko , who thought fighting on watch rather worse than sleeping . [Harvey]250-harvey was no match for [Dan]260-dan physically , but it says a great deal for [his]250-harvey new training that [he]250-harvey took [his]250-harvey defeat and did not try to get even with [[his]250-harvey conqueror]2371-his conqueror by underhand methods . That was after [he]250-harvey had been cured of a string of boils between [his]250-harvey elbows and wrists , where the wet jersey and oilskins cut into the flesh . The salt water stung [them]703-the boys unpleasantly , but when they were ripe [Dan]260-dan treated [them]703-the boys with [Disko]263-disko 's razor , and assured [Harvey]250-harvey that now [he]250-harvey was [a "[2083-mebbe] blooded Banker "]2372-a " blooded banker " ; the affliction of gurry - sores being the mark of the caste that claimed [him]250-harvey . Since [he]260-dan was [a boy]2079-a boy and very busy , [he]260-dan did not bother [his]260-dan head with too much thinking . [He]260-dan was exceedingly sorry for [[his]260-dan mother]1807-his mother , and often longed to see [her]1807-his mother and above all to tell [her]1807-his mother of this wonderful new life , and how brilliantly [he]260-dan was acquitting [himself]260-dan in it . Otherwise [he]260-dan preferred not to wonder too much how [she]1807-his mother was bearing the shock of [his]260-dan supposed death . But one day , as [he]260-dan stood on the foc'sle ladder , guying [the cook]628-the cook , who had accused [him]260-dan and [Dan]260-dan of hooking fried pies , it occurred to [him]260-dan that this was a vast improvement on being snubbed by [strangers]2376-strangers in [the smoking - room of [a hired liner]2378-a hired liner]2377-the smoking - room of a hired liner . [He]260-dan was a recognized part of the scheme of things on [the [We]2379-the we 're here 're Here]2379-the we 're here ; had [his]260-dan place at the table and among the bunks ; and could hold [his]260-dan own in the long talks on stormy days , when [the others]620-the others were always ready to listen to what [they]620-the others called [his]260-dan "[949-the elector o ' gloucester] fairy - tales " of [his]260-dan life ashore . It did not take [him]260-dan more than two days and a quarter to feel that if [he]260-dan spoke of [his]260-dan own life - it seemed very far away - [no one]1898-no one except [Dan]260-dan and even [Dan]260-dan 's belief was sorely tried credited [him]260-dan . So [he]260-dan invented [a friend]828-a friend , [a boy [he]260-dan had heard of , who drove [a miniature four - pony drag]2384-a miniature four - pony drag in [Toledo]83-toledo , [Ohio]39-ohio]2383-a boy he had heard of , who drove a miniature four - pony drag in toledo , ohio , and ordered five suits of clothes at a time and led things called "[951-germans] [germans]951-germans " at parties where [the oldest girl]2385-the oldest girl was not quite fifteen , but all the presents were solid silver . [Salters]276-uncle salters protested that this kind of yarn was desperately wicked , if not indeed positively blasphemous , but [he]260-dan listened as greedily as [the others]620-the others ; and [their]620-the others criticisms at the end gave [Harvey]250-harvey entirely new notions on "[949-the elector o ' gloucester] germans , " clothes , cigarettes with gold - leaf tips , rings , watches , scent , small dinner - parties , champagne , card - playing , and [hotel accommodation]2387-hotel accommodation . Little by little [he]260-dan changed [his]260-dan tone when speaking of [[his]260-dan "[949-the elector o ' gloucester] friend]2388-his " friend , " whom [Long Jack]273-long jack had christened "[350-the crazy kid] [the Crazy Kid]350-the crazy kid , " "[350-the crazy kid] [the Gilt - edged Baby]351-the gilt - edged baby , " "[351-the gilt - edged baby] the Suckin ' Vanderpoop , " and other pet names ; and with [his]260-dan sea - booted feet cocked up on the table would even invent histories about silk pajamas and specially imported neckwear , to [the "[351-the gilt - edged baby] friend]2389-the " friend 's " discredit . [Harvey]250-harvey was [a very adaptable person]2390-a very adaptable person , with a keen eye and ear for every face and tone about [him]250-harvey . Before long [he]250-harvey knew where [Disko]263-disko kept the old greencrusted quadrant that [they]620-the others called the "[351-the gilt - edged baby] hog - yoke " - under the bed - bag in [[his]250-harvey bunk]2236-his bunk . When [he]250-harvey took the sun , and with the help of "[352-the old farmer] [The Old Farmer]352-the old farmer 's " almanac found the latitude , [Harvey]250-harvey would jump down into [the cabin]569-the cabin and scratch the reckoning and date with a nail on the rust of the stove - pipe . Now , [the chief engineer of the liner]2393-the chief engineer of the liner could have done no more , and [no engineer of thirty years ' service]2394-no engineer of thirty years ' service could have assumed one half of the ancient - mariner air with which [Harvey]250-harvey , first careful to spit over the side , made public [the schooner]553-the schooner 's position for that day , and then and not till then relieved [Disko]263-disko of the quadrant . There is an etiquette in all these things . The said "[352-the old farmer] hog - yoke , " an Eldridge chart , the farming almanac , [Blunt]353-blunt 's "[352-the old farmer] Coast Pilot , " and [Bowditch]354-bowditch 's "[352-the old farmer] Navigator " were all the weapons [Disko]263-disko needed to guide [him]250-harvey , except the deep - sea lead that was [his]250-harvey spare eye . [Harvey]250-harvey nearly slew [Penn]284-penn with it when [Tom Platt]274-tom platt taught [him]250-harvey first how to "[352-the old farmer] fly the blue pigeon " ; and , though [his]250-harvey strength was not equal to continuous sounding in [any sort of [a sea]878-a sea]2396-any sort of a sea , for calm weather with a seven - pound lead on [shoal water]2398-shoal water [Disko]263-disko used [him]250-harvey freely . As [Dan]260-dan said : "[352-the old farmer] ' Tain't soundin ['s dad]952-'s dad wants . It 's samples . Grease [her]953-her up good , [Harve]250-harvey . " [Harvey]250-harvey would tallow the cup at the end , and carefully bring the sand , shell , sludge , or whatever it might be , to [Disko]263-disko , who fingered and smelt it and gave judgment As has been said , when [Disko]263-disko thought of cod [he]263-disko thought as a cod ; and by some long - tested mixture of instinct and experience , moved the [We]2399-they 're Here from berth to berth , always with the fish , as [a blindfolded chess - player]2400-a blindfolded chess - player moves on the unseen board . But [Disko]263-disko 's board was [the Grand Bank]84-the grand bank - a triangle two hundred and fifty miles on each side - [a waste of [wallowing sea , cloaked with dank fog]2402-wallowing sea , cloaked with dank fog , vexed with gales , harried with drifting ice , scored by the tracks of [the reckless liners]2403-the reckless liners , and dotted with the sails of [the fishing - fleet]492-the fishing - fleet]2401-a waste of wallowing sea , cloaked with dank fog , vexed with gales , harried with drifting ice , scored by the tracks of the reckless liners , and dotted with the sails of the fishing - fleet . For days [they]2399-they worked in fog - [Harvey]250-harvey at the bell - till , grown familiar with the thick airs , [he]250-harvey went out with [Tom Platt]274-tom platt , [his]250-harvey heart rather in [his]250-harvey mouth . But the fog would not lift , and the fish were biting , and [no one]1898-no one can stay helplessly afraid for six hours at a time . [Harvey]250-harvey devoted [himself]250-harvey to [his]250-harvey lines and the gaff or gob - stick as [Tom Platt]274-tom platt called for [them]2399-they ; and [they]2399-they rowed back to [the schooner]553-the schooner guided by the bell and [Tom]274-tom platt 's instinct ; [Manuel]272-manuel 's conch sounding thin and faint beside [them]2399-they . But it was an unearthly experience , and , for the first time in a month , [Harvey]250-harvey dreamed of the shifting , smoking floors of water round [the dory]520-the dory , the lines that strayed away into nothing , and the air above that melted on [the sea]1855-the sea below ten feet from [his]250-harvey straining eyes . A few days later [he]250-harvey was out with [Manuel]272-manuel on what should have been forty - fathom bottom , but the whole length of the roding ran out , and still the anchor found nothing , and [Harvey]250-harvey grew mortally afraid , for that [his]250-harvey last touch with earth was lost . "[250-harvey] Whale - hole , " said [Manuel]272-manuel , hauling in . "[250-harvey] That is good joke on [Disko]263-disko . Come ! " and [he]250-harvey rowed to [the schooner]553-the schooner to find [Tom Platt]274-tom platt and [the others]620-the others jeering at [the skipper]579-the skipper because , for once , [he]250-harvey had led [them]2399-they to [the edge of [the barren Whale - deep]2413-the barren whale - deep]2412-the edge of the barren whale - deep , [the blank hole of [the Grand Bank]84-the grand bank]2414-the blank hole of the grand bank . [They]2399-they made another berth through the fog , and that time the hair of [Harvey]250-harvey 's head stood up when [he]250-harvey went out in [[Manuel]272-manuel 's dory]2415-manuel 's dory . A whiteness moved in the whiteness of the fog with a breath like the breath of the grave , and there was a roaring , a plunging , and spouting . It was [his]250-harvey first introduction to [the dread summer berg of [the Banks]44-the banks]2416-the dread summer berg of the banks , and [he]250-harvey cowered in the bottom of [the boat]528-the boat while [Manuel]272-manuel laughed . There were days , though , clear and soft and warm , when it seemed a sin to do anything but loaf over the hand - lines and spank the drifting ' sun - scalds "[250-harvey] with an oar ; and there were days of light airs , when [Harvey]250-harvey was taught how to steer [the schooner]553-the schooner from [one berth]955-one berth to another . It thrilled through [him]250-harvey when [he]250-harvey first felt the keel answer to [his]250-harvey band on the spokes and slide over the long hollows as the foresail scythed back and forth against the blue sky . That was magnificent , in spite of [Disko]263-disko saying that it would break a snake 's back to follow [his]250-harvey wake . But , as usual , pride ran before a fall . [They]956-they were sailing on the wind with the staysail - an old one , luckily - set , and [Harvey]250-harvey jammed [her]957-her right into it to show [Dan]260-dan how completely [he]250-harvey had mastered the art . The foresail went over with a bang , and the foregaff stabbed and ripped through the staysail , which was , of course , prevented from going over by the mainstay . [They]956-they lowered [the wreck]958-the wreck in awful silence , and [Harvey]250-harvey spent [his]250-harvey leisure hours for the next few days under [Tom Platt]274-tom platt 's lee , learning to use a needle and palm . [Dan]260-dan hooted with joy , for , as [he]260-dan said , [he]260-dan had made the very same blunder [himself]260-dan in [his]260-dan early days . [Boylike]959-boylike , [Harvey]250-harvey imitated [all the men]960-all the men by turns , till [he]250-harvey had combined [Disko]263-disko 's peculiar stoop at the wheel , Long [Jack]273-long jack 's swinging overhand when the lines were hauled , [Manuel]272-manuel 's round - shouldered but effective stroke in a dory , and [Tom Platt]274-tom platt 's generous Ohio stride along [the deck]517-the deck . " ' Tis beautiful to see how [he]250-harvey takes to ut , "[273-long jack] said [Long Jack]273-long jack , when [Harvey]250-harvey was looking out by the windlass one thick noon . " [I]250-harvey 'll lay [my]250-harvey wage an ' share ' tis more'n half play - actin ' to [him]250-harvey , an ' [he]250-harvey consates [himself]250-harvey [he]250-harvey 's [a bowld mariner]2418-a bowld mariner . Watch [his]250-harvey little bit av a back now ! "[250-harvey] " That 's the way [we]2419-we all begin , "[274-tom platt] said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . " [The boys]703-the boys [they]703-the boys make believe all the time till [they]703-the boys 've cheated ' emselves into [bein ' men]2421-bein ' men , an ' so till [they]703-the boys die - pretendin ' an ' pretendin ' . [I]962-i done it on the old [Ohio]39-ohio , [I]962-i know . Stood [my]962-i first watch - harbor - watch - feelin ' finer'n [Farragut]86-farragut . [Dan]260-dan 's full o ' the same kind o ' notions . See ['em]2422-'em now , actin ' to be genewine moss - backs - very hair a rope - yarn an ' blood Stockholm tar . "[962-i] [He]962-i spoke down [the cabin stairs]963-the cabin stairs . " Guess [you]263-disko 're mistook in [your]263-disko judgments fer once , [Disko]263-disko . What in [Rome]87-rome made [ye]263-disko tell [us]2423-us all [here]1800-here [the kid]2425-the kid was crazy ? "[962-i] " [He]2425-the kid wuz , "[263-disko] [Disko]263-disko replied . " Crazy ez [a loon]2426-a loon when [he]2425-the kid come aboard ; but [I]263-disko 'll say [he]2425-the kid 's sobered up consid'ble sence . [I]263-disko cured [him]2425-the kid . "[263-disko] " [He]2425-the kid yarns good , "[274-tom platt] said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . " T'other night [he]2425-the kid told [us]2423-us abaout [a kid of [his]2425-the kid own size]2427-a kid of his own size steerin ' a cunnin ' little rig an ' four ponies up an ' [down [Toledo]83-toledo , [Ohio]39-ohio]2428-down toledo , ohio , [I]274-tom platt think ' twas , an ' givin ' suppers to [a crowd o ' sim'lar kids]2429-a crowd o ' sim'lar kids . Cur'us kind o ' fairy - tale , but blame interestin ' . [He]2425-the kid knows scores of 'em . "[274-tom platt] " Guess [he]2425-the kid strikes 'em outen [his]2425-the kid own head , "[263-disko] [Disko]263-disko called from [the cabin]569-the cabin , where [he]263-disko was busy with the logbook . " Stands to reason that sort is all made up . It do n't take in [no one]1898-no one but [Dan]260-dan , an ' [he]2425-the kid laughs at it . [I]263-disko 've heard [him]2425-the kid , behind [my]263-disko back . "[263-disko] " [Yever]2431-yever hear what [Sim'on Peter Ca'houn]355-sim'on peter ca'houn said when [they]2432-they whacked up a match ' twix ' [[his]355-sim'on peter ca'houn sister]2433-his sister Hitty an ' Lorin ' Jerauld , an ' [the boys]703-the boys put up that joke on [him]355-sim'on peter ca'houn daown to [Georges]356-georges ? "[276-uncle salters] drawled [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters , who was dripping peaceably under the lee of [the starboard dory - nest]965-the starboard dory - nest . [Tom Platt]274-tom platt puffed at [his]274-tom platt pipe in scornful silence : [he]276-uncle salters was [a Cape Cod man]966-a cape cod man , and had not known that tale more than twenty years . [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters went on with a rasping chuckie : " [Sim'on Peter Ca'houn]355-sim'on peter ca'houn [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn said , an ' [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn was jest right , abaout [Lorin]357-lorin ' , ' Ha'af on [the taown]2435-the taown , ' [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn said , ' an ' t'other ha'af blame [fool]2436-fool ; an ' [they]703-the boys told [me]276-uncle salters [she]2437-she 's married [a ' ich man]2438-a ' ich man . ' [Sim'on Peter Ca'houn]355-sim'on peter ca'houn [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn hedn't no roof to [his]355-sim'on peter ca'houn mouth , an ' talked that way . "[276-uncle salters] " [He]355-sim'on peter ca'houn did n't talk any [Pennsylvania Dutch]358-pennsylvania dutch , "[274-tom platt] [Tom Platt]274-tom platt replied . " [You]2439-you 'd better leave [a Cape man]2440-a cape man to tell that tale . [The Ca'houns]359-the ca'houns was gypsies frum ' way back . "[274-tom platt] " [Wal]360-wal , [I]276-uncle salters do n't profess to be [any elocutionist]2441-any elocutionist , "[276-uncle salters] [Salters]276-uncle salters said . " [I]276-uncle salters 'm comin ' to the moral o ' things . That 's jest abaout what aour Harve be ! Ha'af on [the taown]2435-the taown , an ' t'other ha'af blame [fool]2436-fool ; an ' there 's some'll believe [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn 's [a rich man]2444-a rich man . [Yah]2445-yah ! "[276-uncle salters] " Did [ye]2439-you ever think how sweet ' twould be to sail wid [a full crew o ' [Salterses]361-salterses]2446-a full crew o ' salterses ? "[273-long jack] said [Long Jack]273-long jack . " Ha'af in the furrer an ' [other ha'af in the muck - heap]2447-other ha'af in the muck - heap , as [Ca'houn]355-sim'on peter ca'houn did not say , an ' makes out [he]355-sim'on peter ca'houn 's [a fisherman]581-a fisherman ! "[273-long jack] A little laugh went round at [Salters]276-uncle salters 's expense . [Disko]263-disko held [his]263-disko tongue , and wrought over the log - book that [he]263-disko kept in a hatchet - faced , square hand ; this was the kind of thing that ran on , page after soiled page : " July 17 . This day thick fog and few fish . Made berth to northward . So ends this day . "[263-disko] July 18 . This day comes in with thick fog . Caught a few fish . " July 19 . This day comes in with light breeze from N.E. and fine weather . Made a berth to eastward . Caught plenty fish . "[968-hev] July 20 . This , the Sabbath , comes in with fog and light winds . So ends this day . Total fish caught this week , 3,478 . " [They]2449-they never worked on Sundays , but shaved , and washed [themselves]2449-they if it were fine , and [Pennsylvania]358-pennsylvania dutch sang hymns . Once or twice [he]263-disko suggested that , if ft was not an impertinence , [he]263-disko thought [he]263-disko could preach a little . [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters nearly jumped down [his]276-uncle salters throat at the mere notion , reminding [him]276-uncle salters that [he]276-uncle salters was not [a preacher]2450-a preacher and must n't think of such things . "[967-they] [We]967-they 'd [hev]968-hev [him]263-disko rememberin ' [Johns - town]88-johns - town next , " [Salters]276-uncle salters explained , "[968-hev] an ' what would happen then ? " so [they]967-they compromised on [his]276-uncle salters reading aloud from a book called "[362-josephus] [Josephus]362-josephus . " It was an old leather - bound volume , smelling of a hundred voyages , very solid and very like the Bible , but enlivened with accounts of battles and sieges ; and [they]967-they read it nearly from cover to cover . Otherwise [Penn]284-penn was a silent little body . [He]284-penn would not utter a word for three days on end sometimes , though [he]284-penn played checkers , listened to the songs , and laughed at the stories . When [they]967-they tried to stir [him]284-penn up , [he]284-penn would answer : "[362-josephus] [I]0-i do n't wish to seem unneighbourly , but it is because [I]0-i have nothing to say . [My]0-i head feels quite empty . [I]0-i 've almost forgotten [my]0-i name . " [He]284-penn would turn to [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters with an expectant smile . "[0-i] Why , [Pennsylvania Pratt]363-pennsylvania pratt , " [Salters]276-uncle salters would shout "[363-pennsylvania pratt] [You]363-pennsylvania pratt 'll fergit [me]0-i next ! " "[363-pennsylvania pratt] No - never , " [Penn]284-penn would say , shutting [his]284-penn lips firmly . "[363-pennsylvania pratt] [Pennsylvania Pratt]363-pennsylvania pratt , of course , " [he]284-penn would repeat over and over . Sometimes it was [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters who forgot , and told [him]284-penn [he]284-penn was [Haskins]364-haskins or [Rich]365-rich or [McVitty]366-mcvitty ; but [Penn]284-penn was equally content - till next time . [He]284-penn was always very tender with [Harvey]250-harvey , whom [he]284-penn pitied both as [a lost child]2451-a lost child and as [a lunatic]2452-a lunatic ; and when [Salters]276-uncle salters saw that [Penn]284-penn liked [the boy]1817-the boy , [he]276-uncle salters relaxed , too . [Salters]276-uncle salters was not [an amiable person]2454-an amiable person [He]276-uncle salters esteemed it [his]276-uncle salters business to keep [the boys]703-the boys in order ; and the first time [Harvey]250-harvey , in fear and trembling , on a still day , managed to shin up to the main - truck [Dan]260-dan was behind [him]250-harvey ready to help , [he]250-harvey esteemed it [his]250-harvey duty to hang [Salters]276-uncle salters 's big sea - boots up there - a sight of shame and derision to [the nearest schooner]2456-the nearest schooner . With [Disko]263-disko , [Harvey]250-harvey took no liberties ; not even when [the old man]1812-the old man dropped direct orders , and treated [him]250-harvey , like [the rest of [the crew]728-the crew]2458-the rest of the crew , to "[363-pennsylvania pratt] Do n't [you]969-you want to do so and so ? " and "[363-pennsylvania pratt] Guess [you]969-you 'd better , " and so forth . There was something about the clean - shaven lips and the puckered corners of the eyes that was mightily sobering to young blood . [Disko]263-disko showed [him]250-harvey the meaning of the thumbed and pricked chart , which , [he]263-disko said , laid over any government publication whatsoever ; led [him]250-harvey , pencil in hand , from [berth]2460-berth to berth over the whole string of banks - [Le Have]89-le have , [Western]367-western , [Banquereau]90-banquereau , [St. Pierre]91-st. pierre , [Green]368-green , and Grand - talking "[363-pennsylvania pratt] cod " meantime . Taught [him]250-harvey , too , the principle on which the "[363-pennsylvania pratt] hog - yoke " was worked . In this [Harvey]250-harvey excelled [Dan]260-dan , for [he]250-harvey had inherited a head for figures , and the notion of stealing information from one glimpse of the sullen Bank sun appealed to all [his]250-harvey keen wits . For other sea - matters [his]250-harvey age handicapped [him]250-harvey . As [Disko]263-disko said , [he]250-harvey should have begun when [he]250-harvey was ten . [Dan]260-dan could bait up trawl or lay [his]260-dan hand on any rope in the dark ; and at a pinch , when [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters had a gurry - score on [his]276-uncle salters palm , could dress down by sense of touch . [He]260-dan could steer in anything short of half a gale from the feel of the wind on [his]260-dan face , humouring the ' [We]2461-we 're Here ' just when [she]2462-she needed it . These things [he]260-dan did as automatically as [he]260-dan skipped about the rigging , or made [his]260-dan dory a part of [his]260-dan own will and body . But [he]260-dan could not communicate [his]260-dan knowledge to [Harvey]250-harvey . Still there was a good deal of general information flying about [the schooner]553-the schooner on stormy days , when [they]553-the schooner lay up in the foc'sle or sat on the cabin lockers , while spare eye - bolts , leads , and rings rolled and rattled in the pauses of the talk . [Disko]263-disko spoke of whaling voyages in [the Fifties]92-the fifties ; of great she - whales slain beside [[their]553-the schooner young]2464-their young ; of death agonies on [the black tossing seas]2465-the black tossing seas , and blood that spurted forty feet in the air ; of [boats]2466-boats smashed to splinters ; of patent rockets that went off wrong - end - first and bombarded [the trembling crews]2467-the trembling crews ; of cutting - in and boiling - down , and that terrible "[363-pennsylvania pratt] nip " of ' 71 , when [twelve hundred men]2468-twelve hundred men were made homeless on the ice in three days - wonderful tales , all true . But more wonderful still were [his]263-disko stories of the cod , and how [they]553-the schooner argued and reasoned on [[their]553-the schooner private businesses]2469-their private businesses deep down below the keel . [Long Jack]273-long jack 's tastes ran more to the supernatural . [He]260-dan held [them]553-the schooner silent with ghastly stories of the "[363-pennsylvania pratt] Yo - hoes " on [Monomoy Beach]93-monomoy beach , that mock and terrify [lonely clam - diggers]2470-lonely clam - diggers ; of [sand - walkers]2471-sand - walkers and [dune - haunters who were never properly buried]2472-dune - haunters who were never properly buried ; of hidden treasure on [Fire Island]61-fire island guarded by [the spirits of [[Kidd]369-kidd 's men]2474-kidd 's men]2473-the spirits of kidd 's men ; of ships that sailed in the fog straight over [Truro township]94-truro township ; of [that harbor in [Maine]95-maine where no one but [a stranger]2476-a stranger will lie at anchor twice in a certain place because of]2475-that harbor in maine where no one but a stranger will lie at anchor twice in a certain place because of [a dead crew who row alongside at midnight with the anchor in the bow of [[their]2477-a dead crew who row alongside at midnight with the anchor in the bow of their old - fashioned boat old - fashioned boat]2478-their old - fashioned boat]2477-a dead crew who row alongside at midnight with the anchor in the bow of their old - fashioned boat , whistling - not calling , but whistling - for the soul of [the man who broke [their]2477-a dead crew who row alongside at midnight with the anchor in the bow of their old - fashioned boat rest]2479-the man who broke their rest . [Harvey]250-harvey had a notion that [the east coast of [[his]250-harvey native land]2481-his native land , from [Mount Desert]96-mount desert south , was populated chiefly by [people who took [their]2482-people who took their horses there in the summer and entertained in country - houses with hardwood floors and vantine portires horses there in the summer and entertained in [country - houses with hardwood floors and Vantine portires]2483-country - houses with hardwood floors and vantine portires]2482-people who took their horses there in the summer and entertained in country - houses with hardwood floors and vantine portires]2480-the east coast of his native land , from mount desert south , was populated chiefly by people who took their horses there in the summer and entertained in country - houses with hardwood floors and vantine portires . [He]250-harvey laughed at the ghost - tales , - not as much as [he]250-harvey would have done a month before , - but ended by sitting still and shuddering . [Tom Platt]274-tom platt dealt with [his]274-tom platt interminable trip round [the Horn]38-the horn on [the old Ohio]842-the old ohio in flogging days , with [a navy more extinct than [the dodo]2486-the dodo]2485-a navy more extinct than the dodo - [the navy that passed away in the great war]2487-the navy that passed away in the great war . [He]274-tom platt told [them]2488-them how red - hot shot are dropped into a cannon , a wad of wet clay between [them]2488-them and the cartridge ; how they sizzle and reek when they strike wood , and how [the little ship - boys of [the Miss Jim Buck]309-the miss jim buck]2489-the little ship - boys of the miss jim buck hove water over [them]2488-them and shouted to [the fort]2490-the fort to try again . And [he]274-tom platt told tales of blockade - long weeks of swaying at anchor , varied only by the departure and return of steamers that had used up [their]2489-the little ship - boys of the miss jim buck coal there was no chance for [the sailing - ships]2491-the sailing - ships ; of gales and cold that kept [two hundred men , night and day]2492-two hundred men , night and day , pounding and chopping at the ice on cable , blocks , and rigging , when [the galley]2493-the galley was as red - hot as [the fort]2490-the fort 's shot , and [men]2279-men drank cocoa by the bucket . [Tom Platt]274-tom platt had no use for steam . [His]274-tom platt service closed when that thing was comparatively new . [He]274-tom platt admitted that it was a specious invention in time of peace , but looked hopefully for the day when sails should come back again on [ten - thousand - ton frigates with hundred - and - ninety - foot booms]2496-ten - thousand - ton frigates with hundred - and - ninety - foot booms . [Manuel]272-manuel 's talk was slow and gentle - all about [pretty girls in [Madeira]97-madeira washing clothes in the dry beds of streams]2497-pretty girls in madeira washing clothes in the dry beds of streams , by moonlight , under waving bananas ; legends of [saints]2498-saints , and tales of queer dances or fights away in the cold Newfoundland baiting - ports [Salters]276-uncle salters was mainly agricultural ; for , though [he]274-tom platt read "[362-josephus] [Josephus]362-josephus " and expounded it , [his]274-tom platt mission in life was to prove the value of green manures , and specially of clover , against every form of phosphate whatsoever . [He]274-tom platt grew libellous about phosphates ; [he]274-tom platt dragged greasy "[363-pennsylvania pratt] Orange Judd " books from [his]274-tom platt bunk and intoned them , wagging [his]274-tom platt finger at [Harvey]250-harvey , to whom it was all Greek . [Little Penn]284-penn was so genuinely pained when [Harvey]250-harvey made fun of [Salters]276-uncle salters 's lectures that [the boy]1817-the boy gave it up , and suffered in polite silence . That was very good for [Harvey]250-harvey . [The cook]628-the cook naturally did not join in these conversations . As a rule , [he]250-harvey spoke only when it was absolutely necessary ; but at times a queer gift of speech descended on [him]250-harvey , and [he]250-harvey held forth , half in Gaelic , half in broken English , an hour at a time . [He]250-harvey was especially communicative with [the boys]703-the boys , and [he]250-harvey never withdrew [his]250-harvey prophecy that one day [Harvey]250-harvey would be [[Dan]260-dan 's master]2502-dan 's master , and that [he]250-harvey would see it . [He]250-harvey told [them]703-the boys of mail - carrying in the winter up [Cape Breton]42-cape breton way , of the dog - train that goes to [Coudray]98-coudray , and of [the ram - steamer Arctic]2503-the ram - steamer arctic , that breaks the ice between [the mainland]2504-the mainland and [Prince Edward Island]99-prince edward island . Then [he]250-harvey told [them]703-the boys stories that [[his]250-harvey mother]1807-his mother had told [him]250-harvey , of life far to [the southward]2506-the southward , where [water never froze]2507-water never froze ; and [he]250-harvey said that when [he]250-harvey died [his]250-harvey soul would go to lie down on [a warm white beach of sand]2508-a warm white beach of sand with palm - trees waving above . That seemed to [the boys]703-the boys a very odd idea for [a man who had never seen a palm in [his]250-harvey life]2510-a man who had never seen a palm in his life . Then , too , regularly at each meal , [he]250-harvey would ask [Harvey]250-harvey , and [Harvey]250-harvey alone , whether the cooking was to [his]250-harvey taste ; and this always made the ' second half "[363-pennsylvania pratt] laugh . Yet [they]970-they had a great respect for [the cook]628-the cook 's judgment , and in [their]970-they hearts considered [Harvey]250-harvey something of [a mascot]972-a mascot by consequence . And while [Harvey]250-harvey was taking in knowledge of new things at each pore and hard health with every gulp of the good air , [the We 're Here]2379-the we 're here went [her]628-the cook ways and did [her]628-the cook business on [the Bank]974-the bank , and the silvery - gray kenches of well - pressed fish mounted higher and higher in the hold . No one day 's work was out of common , but the average days were many and close together . Naturally , [a man of Disko]975-a man of disko 's reputation was closely watched - ' scrowged upon , " [Dan]260-dan called it - by [[his]260-dan neighbours]2511-his neighbours , but [he]260-dan had a very pretty knack of giving [them]2511-his neighbours the slip through the curdling , glidy fog - banks . [Disko]263-disko avoided [company]2512-company for two reasons . [He]263-disko wished to make [his]263-disko own experirnents , in the first place ; and in the second , [he]263-disko objected to the mixed gatherings of [a fleet of [all nations]2514-all nations]2513-a fleet of all nations . The bulk of [them]2513-a fleet of all nations were [mainly [Gloucester]19-gloucester boats , with a scattering from [Provincetown]100-provincetown , [Harwich]54-harwich , [Chatham]101-chatham , and [some of [the Maine]2517-the maine ports]2516-some of the maine ports]2515-mainly gloucester boats , with a scattering from provincetown , harwich , chatham , and some of the maine ports , but [the crews]2518-the crews drew from goodness knows where . Risk breeds recklessness , and when greed is added there are fine chances for every kind of accident in [the crowded fleet]2519-the crowded fleet , which , like [a mob of sheep]2520-a mob of sheep , is huddled round [some unrecognized leader]2521-some unrecognized leader . "[370-the two jeraulds] Let [the two Jeraulds]370-the two jeraulds lead ['em]976-'em , " said [Disko]263-disko . "[370-the two jeraulds] [We]370-the two jeraulds 're baound to lay among 'em for a spell on [the Eastern Shoals]102-the eastern shoals ; though ef luck holds , [we]370-the two jeraulds wo n't [hev]977-hev to lay long . Where [we]370-the two jeraulds are naow , Harve , ai n't considered noways good graound . " "[370-the two jeraulds] Ai n't it ? " said [Harvey]250-harvey , who was drawing water [he]250-harvey had learned just how to wiggle the bucket , after an unusually long dressing - down . "[370-the two jeraulds] Should n't mind striking some poor ground for a change , then . " "[370-the two jeraulds] All the graound [I]0-i want to see - do n't want to strike [her]978-her - is [Eastern Point]57-eastern point , " said [Dan]260-dan . [You]979-you 'll meet all the comp'ny [you]979-you want then , [Harve]979-you . That 's the time [we]370-the two jeraulds begin to work . No reg'lar meals fer [no one]1898-no one then . ' Mug - up when [ye're]979-you hungry , an ' sleep when [ye]979-you ca n't keep awake . Good job [you]979-you was n't picked up a month later than [you]979-you was , or [we]370-the two jeraulds 'd never ha ' had [you]979-you dressed in shape fer [the Old Virgin]981-the old virgin . " [Harvey]250-harvey understood from the Eldridge chart that [the Old Virgin]371-the virgin and [a nest of curiously named shoals]2522-a nest of curiously named shoals were the turning - point of the cruise , and that with good luck [they]2523-they would wet the balance of [their]2523-they salt there . But seeing the size of [the Virgin]371-the virgin it was one tiny dot , [he]250-harvey wondered how even [Disko]263-disko with the hog - yoke and the lead could find [her]981-the old virgin . [He]250-harvey learned later that [Disko]263-disko was entirely equal to that and any other business and could even help [others]2051-others . Then the trade began . [They]985-they had tobacco , plenty of it - American , that had never paid duty to [France]108-france . [They]985-they wanted chocolate and crackers . [Harvey]250-harvey rowed back to arrange with [the cook]628-the cook and [Disko]263-disko , who owned [the stores]2540-the stores , and on [his]250-harvey return the cocoa - tins and cracker - bags were counted out by [the Frenchman]2541-the frenchman 's wheel . It looked like a piratical division of loot ; but [Tom Platt]274-tom platt came out of [it]2542-it roped with black pigtail and stuffed with cakes of chewing and smoking tobacco . Then [those jovial mariners]2543-those jovial mariners swung off into the mist , and the last [Harvey]250-harvey heard was a gay chorus : "[1873-young feller] Par derriere chez ma tante , il'y a un bois joli , Et le rossignol y chante Et le jour et la nuit .... [CHAPTER VI]378-chapter vi The thing that struck [him]250-harvey most was the exceedingly casual way in which [some craft]2548-some craft loafed about [the broad Atlantic]112-the broad atlantic . [Fishing - boats]2549-fishing - boats , as [Dan]260-dan said , were naturally dependent on the courtesy and wisdom of [[their]2549-fishing - boats neighbours]2550-their neighbours ; but [one]2031-one expected better things of [steamers]2552-steamers . That was after another interesting interview , when [they]2549-fishing - boats had been chased for three miles by [a big lumbering old cattle - boat]2553-a big lumbering old cattle - boat , all boarded over on the upper deck , that smelt like a thousand cattle - pens . ' sez [Counahan]384-counahan [he]384-counahan always said that whin [his]384-counahan pumps sucked an ' [he]384-counahan was not feelin ' good - ' Sufferin ' Christianity ! ' "[384-counahan] [Counahan]384-counahan fetched wan jump , four feet sivin inches , measured by [the cook]628-the cook . " ' Consolation ! ' sez [he]384-counahan , bould as brass . ' [D'ye]2596-d'ye take [me]384-counahan fer a dialect ? [Thirty - five mile from [Cape Clear]120-cape clear]2597-thirty - five mile from cape clear , an ' fourteen days from [Boston Light]117-boston light . Sufferin ' Christianity , ' tis a record , an ' by the same token [I]384-counahan 've [a mother to [Skibbereen]122-skibbereen]2598-a mother to skibbereen ! ' Think av ut ! The gall av um ! But [ye]2596-d'ye see [he]1034-one marylander that wanted to go back could niver keep things sep'rate . "[384-counahan] [The crew]728-the crew was mostly [Cork]123-cork an ' [Kerry men]1033-kerry men , barrin ' [one Marylander that wanted to go back]1034-one marylander that wanted to go back , but [they]728-the crew called [him]1034-one marylander that wanted to go back [a mutineer]1035-a mutineer , an ' [they]728-the crew ran [the ould Marilla]1036-the ould marilla into [Skibbereen]122-skibbereen , an ' [they]728-the crew had an illigant time visitin ' around with frinds on the ould sod fer a week . Thin [they]728-the crew wint back , an ' it cost 'em two an ' thirty days to beat to [the Banks]44-the banks again . ' Twas gettin ' on towards fall , and grub was low , so [Counahan]384-counahan ran [her]1037-her back to [Boston]23-boston , wid no more bones to ut . " "[384-counahan] And what did [the firm]1038-the firm say ? " [Harvey]250-harvey demanded . "[1038-the firm] Fwhat could [they]1038-the firm ? The fish was on [the Banks]44-the banks , an ' [Counahan]384-counahan was at [T - wharf]834-t - wharf talkin ' av [his]384-counahan record trip east ! [They]1038-the firm tuk [their]1038-the firm satisfaction out av that , an ' ut all came [av]1040-av not keepin ' [the crew]728-the crew and the rum sep'rate in the first place ; an ' confusin ' [Skibbereen]122-skibbereen wid ' [Queereau]391-queereau , in the second . [Counahan]384-counahan [the Navigator]2590-the navigator , rest [his]384-counahan sowl ! [He]384-counahan was [an imprompju citizen]1043-an imprompju citizen ! " "[384-counahan] Once [I]0-i was in [the Lucy Holmes]319-lucy holmes , " said [Manuel]272-manuel , in [his]0-i gentle voice . "[1038-the firm] [They]1038-the firm not want any of [her]1044-her feesh in [Gloucester]19-gloucester . Eh , wha - at ? Give [us]1045-we no price . So [we]1045-we go across [the water]585-the water , and think to sell to [some Fayal man]1047-some fayal man . Then it blow fresh , and [we]1045-we can not see well . Eh , wha - at ? Then it blow some more fresh , and [we]1045-we go down below and drive very fast - [no one]1898-no one know where . By and by [we]1045-we see [a land]1049-a land , and it get some hot . Then come two , three nigger in a brick . Eh , wha - at ? [We]1045-we ask where [we]1045-we are , and [they]1038-the firm say - now , what [you]1045-we all think ? " "[1038-the firm] [Grand Canary]125-grand canary , " said [Disko]263-disko , after a moment . [Manuel]272-manuel shook [his]272-manuel head , smiling . "[392-blanco] [Blanco]392-blanco , " said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . "[392-blanco] No . Worse than that . " "[38-the horn] Can [a schooner like this]1051-a schooner like this go right across to [Africa]128-africa ? " said [Harvey]250-harvey . "[38-the horn] Go araound [the Horn]38-the horn ef there 's anythin ' worth goin' fer , and the grub holds aout , " said [Disko]263-disko . "[1910-my father] [[My]0-i father]1910-my father [he]1910-my father run [his]1910-my father packet , an ' [she]1050-she was a kind o ' pinkey , abaout fifty ton , [I]0-i guess , - [the Rupert]1053-the rupert , - [he]1910-my father run [her]1050-she over to [[Greenland]129-greenland 's icy mountains]1054-greenland 's icy mountains the year ha'af [[our]1045-we fleet]1055-our fleet was tryin ' after cod [there]1899-there . An ' what 's more , [he]1910-my father took [[my]0-i mother]1946-my mother along with [him]1910-my father , - to show [her]1946-my mother haow the money was earned , [I]0-i presoom , - an ' [they]1058-they was all iced up , an ' [I]0-i was born at [Disko]263-disko . Do n't remember nothin' abaout it , o ' course . [We]1045-we come back when the ice eased in the spring , but [they]1058-they named [me]0-i fer [the place]527-the place . Kinder mean trick to put up on [a baby]1060-a baby , but [we]1045-we 're all baound to make mistakes in aour lives . " "[1058-they] Sure ! Sure ! " said [Salters]276-uncle salters , wagging [his]276-uncle salters head . "[1058-they] All baound to make mistakes , an ' [I]0-i tell [[you]1061-you two boys]1062-you two boys here thet after [you]1061-you 've made a mistake - [ye]1061-you do n't make fewer'n a hundred a day - the next best thing 's to own up to it like [men]2279-men . " [Long Jack]273-long jack winked one tremendous wink that embraced all hands except [Disko]263-disko and [Salters]276-uncle salters , and the incident was closed . Then [they]1045-we made berth after berth to [the northward]2599-the northward , [the dories]552-the dories out almost every day , running along [the east edge of [the Grand Bank]1848-the grand bank]2601-the east edge of the grand bank in thirty- to forty - fathom water , and fishing steadily . It was here [Harvey]250-harvey first met the squid , who is one of the best cod - baits , but uncertain in [his]250-harvey moods . [They]1045-we were waked out of [[their]1045-we bunks]2603-their bunks one black night by yells of "[0-i] Squid O ! " from [Salters]276-uncle salters , and for an hour and a half [every soul aboard]2604-every soul aboard hung over [his]2604-every soul aboard squid - jig - a piece of lead painted red and armed at the lower end with a circle of pins bent backward like half - opened umbrella ribs . [The squid]2605-the squid - for some unknown reason - likes , and wraps [himself]2605-the squid round , this thing , and is hauled up ere [he]2605-the squid can escape from the pins . But as [he]2605-the squid leaves [[his]2605-the squid home]2606-his home [he]2605-the squid squirts first water and next ink into [[his]2605-the squid captor]2607-his captor 's face ; and it was curious to see [the men]1868-the men weaving [their]1868-the men heads from side to side to dodge the shot . [They]1045-we were as black as sweeps when the flurry ended ; but a pile of fresh squid lay on [the deck]517-the deck , and the large cod thinks very well of a little shiny piece of squid tentacle at the tip of a clam - baited hook . Next day [they]1045-we caught many fish , and met [the Carrie Pitman]338-the carrie pitman , to whom [they]1045-we shouted [their]1045-we luck , and [she]338-the carrie pitman wanted to trade - seven cod for one fair - sized squid ; but [Disko]263-disko would not agree at the price , and [the Carrie]2610-the carrie dropped sullenly to leeward and anchored half a mile away , in the hope of striking on to some for [herself]338-the carrie pitman . [Disco]394-disco said nothing till after supper , when [he]394-disco sent [Dan]260-dan and [Manuel]272-manuel out to buoy the ' [We]1045-we 're Here 's ' cable and announced [his]394-disco intention of turning in with the broad - axe . [Dan]260-dan naturally repeated these remarks to the dory from [the Carrie]2610-the carrie , who wanted to know why [they]1045-we were buoying [their]1045-we cable , since [they]1045-we were not on [rocky bottom]2612-rocky bottom . "[259-dad] [Dad]259-dad sez [he]259-dad would n't trust [a ferryboat]1064-a ferryboat within five mile o ' [you]1065-you , " [Dan]260-dan howled cheerfully . "[259-dad] Why do n't [he]259-dad git out , then ? Who 's hinderin ' ? " said [the other]2613-the other . "[1065-you] 'Cause [you]1065-you 've jest the same ez lee - bowed [him]259-dad , an ' [he]259-dad do n't take that from [any boat]1066-any boat , not to speak o ' sech a driftin ' gurry - butt as [you]1065-you be . " "[1067-she] [She]1067-she ai n't driftin ' any this trip , " said [the man]515-the man angrily , for [the Carrie Pitman]338-the carrie pitman had an unsavory reputation for breaking [her]1067-she ground - tackle . "[1067-she] Then haow d'you make berths ? " said [Dan]260-dan . "[1067-she] It 's [her]1067-she best p'int o ' sailin ' . An ' ef [she]1067-she 's quit driftin ' , what in thunder are [you]1065-you doin' with a new jib - boom ? " [That shot]2615-that shot went [home]545-home . "[1065-you] Hey , [[you]1065-you Portugoosy organ - grinder]1068-you portugoosy organ - grinder , take [your]1065-you monkey back to [Gloucester]19-gloucester . " yelled [Dan]260-dan , who knew that [one of [[the Carrie]338-the carrie pitman 's crew]2618-the carrie 's crew]2617-one of the carrie 's crew had worked in [an overall factory]2619-an overall factory the winter before . "[260-dan] Shrimp ! [Gloucester]19-gloucester shrimp ! Git aout , [[you]1065-you Novy]1070-you novy ! " To call [a Gloucester man]2620-a gloucester man a [Nova Scotian]130-nova scotian is not well received . [Dan]260-dan answered in kind . Git aout with [your]1065-you brick in [your]1065-you stockin ' ! " And [the forces]2621-the forces separated , but [Chatharn]395-chatharn had the worst of it . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew [haow]1074-haow ' twould be , " said [Disko]263-disko . "[0-i] [She]1075-she 's drawed the wind raound already . [Some one]707-some one oughter put a deesist on thet packet . [She]1075-she 'll snore till midnight , an ' jest when [we]1077-we 're gettin ' [our]1077-we sleep [she]1075-she 'll strike adrift . Good job [we]1077-we ai n't crowded with craft hereaways . But [I]0-i ai n't goin' to up anchor fer [Chatham]101-chatham . [She]1075-she may hold . " The wind , which had hauled round , rose at sundown and blew steadily . There was not enough sea , though , to disturb even [a dory]790-a dory 's tackle , but [the Carrie Pitman]338-the carrie pitman was a law unto [herself]338-the carrie pitman . At the end of [the boys]703-the boys ' watch [they]703-the boys heard the crack - crack - crack of a huge muzzle - loading revolver aboard [her]1075-she . "[1075-she] Gory , glory , hallelujah ! " sung [Dan]260-dan . "[1075-she] Here [she]1075-she comes , [Dad]259-dad ; butt - end first , walkin ' in [her]1075-she sleep same 's [she]1075-she done on ' [Queereau]391-queereau . " Had [she]1075-she been [any other boat [Disko]263-disko]2624-any other boat disko would have taken [his]263-disko chances , but now [he]263-disko cut the cable as [the Carrie Pitman]338-the carrie pitman , with all the [North Atlantic]64-north atlantic to play in , lurched down directly upon [them]703-the boys . The ' [We]703-the boys 're Here ' , under jib and riding - sail , gave [her]1075-she no more room than was absolutely necessary , - [Disko]263-disko did not wish to spend a week hunting for [his]263-disko cable , - but scuttled up into the wind as [the Carrie]338-the carrie pitman passed within easy hail , [a silent and angry boat]2625-a silent and angry boat , at the mercy of a raking broadside of Bank chaff . "[1075-she] Good evenin ' , " said [Disko]263-disko , raising [his]263-disko head - gear , "[1075-she] an ' haow does [[your]1075-she garden]1078-your garden grow ? " "[1075-she] Go to [Ohio]39-ohio an ' hire a mule , " said [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters . "[1079-we] [We]1079-we do n't want [no farmers]1080-no farmers [here]1800-here . " "[1079-we] Will [I]0-i lend [YOU]0-i [my]0-i dory - anchor ? " cried [Long Jack]273-long jack . "[0-i] Unship [your]0-i rudder an ' stick it in the mud , " bawled [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . "[1079-we] Say ! " [Dan]260-dan 's voice rose shrill and high , as [he]260-dan stood on the wheel - box . "[1079-we] Sa - ay ! Is there a strike in [the o - ver - all factory]1082-the o - ver - all factory ; or [hev]1083-hev [they]1084-they hired [girls]1085-girls , [ye]0-i [Shackamaxons]396-shackamaxons ? " "[0-i] Veer out the tiller - lines , " cried [Harvey]250-harvey , "[0-i] and nail 'em to the bottom ! " That was a salt - flavoured jest [he]250-harvey had been put up to by [Tom Platt]274-tom platt . [Manuel]272-manuel leaned over the stern and yelled : "[397-johanna morgan] [Johanna Morgan]397-johanna morgan play the organ ! Ahaaaa ! " [He]272-manuel flourished [his]272-manuel broad thumb with a gesture of unspeakable contempt and derision , while [little Penn]284-penn covered [himself]284-penn with glory by piping up : "[397-johanna morgan] Gee a little ! Hssh ! Come here . Haw ! " [They]2626-they rode on [their]2626-they chain for the rest of the night , a short , snappy , uneasy motion , as [Harvey]250-harvey found , and wasted half the forenoon recovering the cable . But [the boys]703-the boys agreed the trouble was cheap at the price of triumph and glory , and [they]703-the boys thought with grief over all the beautiful things that [they]703-the boys might have said to [the discomfited Carrie]2628-the discomfited carrie . CHAPTER VII Next day [they]2626-they fell in with more sails , all circling slowly from the east northerly towards the west . But just when [they]2626-they expected to make the shoals by the Virgin the fog shut down , and [they]2626-they anchored , surrounded by the tinklings of invisible bells . There was not much fishing , but occasionally [dory]398-dory met [dory]398-dory in the fog and exchanged news . That night , a little before dawn , [Dan]260-dan and [Harvey , who had been sleeping most of the day]2629-harvey , who had been sleeping most of the day , tumbled out to "[397-johanna morgan] hook " fried pies . There was no reason why [they]2626-they should not have taken [them]2630-them openly ; but [they]2630-them tasted better so , and it made [the cook]628-the cook angry . The heat and smell below drove [them]2626-they on [deck]1866-deck with [their]2626-they plunder , and [they]2626-they found [Disko]263-disko at the bell , which [he]263-disko handed over to [Harvey]250-harvey . "[1086-her] Keep [her]1086-her goin' , " said [he]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i mistrust [I]0-i hear somethin' . Ef it 's anything , [I]0-i 'm best where [I]0-i am so 's to get at things . " It was a forlorn little jingle ; the thick air seemed to pinch it off , and in the pauses [Harvey]250-harvey heard the muffled shriek of [a liner]2084-a liner 's siren , and [he]250-harvey knew enough of the Banks to know what that meant . It came to [him]250-harvey , with horrible distinctness , how [a boy in a cherry - coloured jersey]2634-a boy in a cherry - coloured jersey - [he]2634-a boy in a cherry - coloured jersey despised fancy blazers now with all [a fisher - man]2635-a fisher - man 's contempt - how [an ignorant , rowdy boy]2636-an ignorant , rowdy boy had once said it would be "[0-i] great " if [a steamer]529-a steamer ran down [a fishing - boat]2638-a fishing - boat . [That boy]1809-that boy had [a stateroom]2640-a stateroom with a hot and cold bath , and spent ten minutes each morning picking over a gilt - edged bill of fare . And [that same boy]2641-that same boy - no , [[his]1809-that boy very much older brother]2642-his very much older brother - was up at four of the dim dawn in streaming , crackling oilskins , hammering , literally for the dear life , on a bell smaller than [the steward]1840-the steward 's breakfast - bell , while somewhere close at hand a thirty - foot steel stem was storming along at twenty miles an hour ! The bitterest thought of all was that there were folks asleep in dry , [upholstered cabins]2644-upholstered cabins who would never learn that [they]1087-they had massacred [a boat]2002-a boat before breakfast . So [Harvey]250-harvey rang the bell . "[1087-they] Yes , [they]1087-they slow daown one turn o ' [their]1087-they blame propeller , " said [Dan]260-dan , applying [himself]260-dan to [Manuel]272-manuel 's conch , "[1087-they] fer to keep inside the law , an ' that 's consolin ' when [we]1088-we 're all at the bottom . Hark to [her]1089-her ! [She]1089-her 's [a humper]1090-a humper ! " "[1089-her] Aooo - whoo - whupp ! " went the siren . "[1089-her] Wingle - tingle - tink , " went the bell . "[1089-her] Graaa - ouch ! " went the conch , while [sea and sky]2646-sea and sky were all mired up in milky fog . Then [Harvey]250-harvey felt that [he]250-harvey was near a moving body , and found [himself]250-harvey looking up and up at the wet edge of a cliff - like bow , leaping , it seemed , directly over [the schooner]553-the schooner . A jaunty little feather of water curled in front of it , and as it lifted it showed a long ladder of Roman numerals - XV . , XVI . , XVII . , XVIII . , and so forth - on a salmon - coloured gleaming side . It tilted forward and downward with a heart - stilling "[1089-her] Ssssooo " ; the ladder disappeared ; a line of brass - rimmed port - holes flashed past ; a jet of steam puffed in [Harvey]250-harvey 's helplessly uplifted hands ; a spout of hot water roared along the rail of the ' [We]1088-we 're Here ' , and [the little schooner]2648-the little schooner staggered and shook in a rush of screw - torn water , as [a liner]2084-a liner 's stern vanished in the fog . [Harvey]250-harvey got ready to faint or be sick , or both , when [he]250-harvey heard a crack like a trunk thrown on [a sidewalk]2650-a sidewalk , and , all small in [his]250-harvey ear , a far - away telephone voice drawling : "[1091-you] Heave to ! [You]1091-you 've sunk [us]1088-we ! " "[1091-you] Is it [us]1088-we ? " [he]250-harvey gasped . "[1091-you] No ! Boat out yonder . Ring ! [We]1088-we 're goin' to look , " said [Dan]260-dan , running out [a dory]790-a dory . In half a minute all except [Harvey]250-harvey , [Penn]284-penn , and [the cook]628-the cook were overside and away . Presently [a schooner]779-a schooner 's stump - foremast , snapped clean across , drifted past the bows . Then [an empty green dory]2654-an empty green dory came by , knocking on the ' [We]1088-we 're Here 's ' side , as though [she]2654-an empty green dory wished to be taken in . Then followed something , face down , in a blue jersey , but - it was not the whole of [a man]504-a man . [Penn]284-penn changed colour and caught [his]284-penn breath with a click . [Harvey]250-harvey pounded despairingly at the bell , for [he]250-harvey feared they might be sunk at any minute , and [he]250-harvey jumped at [Dan]260-dan 's hail as [the crew]728-the crew came back . "[399-the jennie cushman] [The Jennie Cushman]399-the jennie cushman , " said [Dan]260-dan , hysterically , "[399-the jennie cushman] cut clean in half - graound up an ' trompled on at that ! Not a quarter of a mile away . [Dad]259-dad 's got [the old man]1812-the old man . There ai n't [any one else]1093-any one else , and - there was [[his]1812-the old man son]1867-his son , too . Oh , [Harve]250-harvey , [Harve]250-harvey , [I]0-i ca n't stand it ! [I]0-i 've seen - " [He]0-i dropped [his]0-i head on [his]0-i arms and sobbed while [the others]620-the others dragged [a gray - headed man]2658-a gray - headed man aboard . "[0-i] What did [you]1095-you pick [me]0-i up for ? " [the stranger]2659-the stranger groaned . "[1095-you] [Disko]263-disko , what did [you]1095-you pick [me]0-i up for ? " [Disko]263-disko dropped a heavy hand on [his]263-disko shoulder , for [the man]515-the man 's eyes were wild and [his]515-the man lips trembled as [he]515-the man stared at [the silent crew]2661-the silent crew . Then up and spoke [Pennsylvania Pratt]363-pennsylvania pratt , who was also [Haskins]364-haskins or Rich or [McVitty]366-mcvitty when [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters forgot ; and [his]0-i face was changed on [him]0-i from the face of [a fool]2662-a fool to the countenance of [an old , wise man]2663-an old , wise man , and [he]0-i said in a strong voice : "[1095-you] [The Lord]1025-the lord gave , and [the Lord]1025-the lord hath taken away ; blessed be the name of [the Lord]1025-the lord ! [I]0-i was - [I]0-i am [a minister of the Gospel]1099-a minister of the gospel . Leave [him]1100-him to [me]0-i . " "[1101-you] Oh , [you]1101-you be , be [you]1101-you ? " said [the man]515-the man . "[1101-you] Then pray [[my]0-i son]2026-my son back to [me]0-i ! Pray back [a nine - thousand - dollar boat]1103-a nine - thousand - dollar boat an ' a thousand quintal of fish . If [you]1101-you 'd left [me]0-i alone [[my]0-i widow]1104-my widow could ha ' gone on to the Provident an ' worked fer [her]1104-my widow board , an ' never known - an ' never known . Now [I]0-i 'll hev to tell [her]1104-my widow . " "[0-i] There ai n't nothin' to say , " said [Disko]263-disko . "[0-i] Better lie down a piece , [Jason Olley]400-jason . " When [a man]504-a man has lost [[his]504-a man only son]2666-his only son , [his]504-a man summer 's work , and [his]504-a man means of livelihood , in thirty counted seconds , it is hard to give consolation . "[400-jason] [All Gloucester men]1105-all gloucester men , was n't [they]1105-all gloucester men ? " said [Tom Platt]274-tom platt , fiddling helplessly with a dory - becket . "[1105-all gloucester men] Oh , that do n't make no odds , " said [Jason]400-jason , wringing the wet from [his]400-jason beard . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll be rowin ' summer boarders araound [East Gloucester]132-east gloucester this fall . " [He]0-i rolled heavily to the rail , singing : "[1105-all gloucester men] Happy birds that sing and fly Round thine altars , O Most High ! " "[1106-mebbe] Come with [me]0-i . Come below ! " said [Penn]284-penn , as though [he]0-i had a right to give orders . [Their]2667-their eyes met and fought for a quarter of a minute . "[0-i] [I]0-i dunno who [you]0-i be , but [I]0-i 'll come , " said [Jason]400-jason submissively . "[1106-mebbe] [Mebbe]1106-mebbe [I]0-i 'll get back some o ' the - some o ' the - nine thousand dollars . " [Penn]284-penn led [him]0-i into [the cabin]569-the cabin and slid the door behind . "[0-i] That ai n't [Penn]284-penn , " cried [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters . "[1107-it] [It]1107-it 's [Jacob Boiler]297-jacob boiler , an ' - [he]297-jacob boiler 's remembered [Johnstown]48-johnstown ! [I]0-i never seed stich eyes in [any livin ' man]1108-any livin ' man 's head . What 's to do naow ? What 'll [I]0-i do naow ? " [They]2667-their could hear [Penn]284-penn 's voice and [Jason]400-jason 's together . Then [Penn]284-penn 's went on alone , and [Salters]276-uncle salters slipped off [his]276-uncle salters hat , for [Penn]284-penn was praying . Presently [the little man]713-the little man came up the steps , huge drops of sweat on [his]713-the little man face , and looked at [the crew]728-the crew . [Dan]260-dan was still sobbing by the wheel . "[0-i] [He]297-jacob boiler do n't know [us]1109-us , " [Salters]276-uncle salters groaned . "[297-jacob boiler] It 's all to do over again , [checkers]1110-checkers and everything - an ' what 'll [he]297-jacob boiler say to [me]0-i ? " [Penn]284-penn spoke ; [they]1109-us could hear that it was to [strangers]2376-strangers . "[297-jacob boiler] [I]0-i have prayed , " said [he]0-i . "[0-i] [[Our]1109-us people]1111-our people believe in prayer . [I]0-i have prayed for the life of [[this man]1112-this man 's son]1113-this man 's son . [Mine]0-i were drowned before [my]0-i eyes - [she]1114-she and [[my]0-i eldest]1115-my eldest and - [the others]620-the others . Shall [a man]504-a man be more wise than [[his]504-a man Maker]1118-his maker ? [I]0-i prayed never for [their]1119-their lives , but [I]0-i have prayed for [[this man]1112-this man 's son]1113-this man 's son , and [he]1113-this man 's son will surely be sent [him]1113-this man 's son . " [Salters]276-uncle salters looked pleadingly at [Penn]284-penn to see if [he]284-penn remembered . "[0-i] How long have [I]0-i been mad ? " [Penn]284-penn asked suddenly . [His]284-penn mouth was twitching . "[249-pshaw] [Pshaw]249-pshaw , [Penn]284-penn ! [You]284-penn were n't never mad , " [Salters]276-uncle salters began "[284-penn] Only a little distracted like . " "[0-i] [I]0-i saw [the houses]2132-the houses strike [the bridge]2557-the bridge before the fires broke out . [I]0-i do not remember any more . How long ago is that ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't stand it ! [I]0-i ca n't stand it ! " cried [Dan]260-dan , and [Harvey]250-harvey whimpered in sympathy . "[0-i] Abaout five year , " said [Disko]263-disko , in a shaking voice . "[0-i] Then [I]0-i have been a charge on some one for every day of that time . Who was [the man]515-the man ? " [Disko]263-disko pointed to [Salters]276-uncle salters . "[284-penn] [Ye]284-penn hain't - [ye]284-penn hain't ! " cried [the sea - farmer]2672-the sea - farmer , twisting [his]2672-the sea - farmer hands together . [He]515-the man 's clean bewitched . " [A schooner]779-a schooner 's bell struck up alongside , and a voice hailed through the fog : "[515-the man] [O Disko]402-disko ! " "[1128-they] Got [Jason]400-jason aboard here , " [Disko]402-disko answered , but [his]402-disko voice quavered . "[400-jason] There - warn't any one else ? [[You]1131-you fellers]1132-you fellers guyed [us]1127-we consid'rable t'other night . " "[1131-you] [We]1127-we do n't feel like guyin ' any now , " said [Disko]402-disko . "[0-i] [I]0-i know it ; but to tell the honest truth [we]1127-we was kinder - kinder driftin ' when [we]1127-we run agin [young Olley]400-jason . " It was the irrepressible [Carrie Pitman]338-the carrie pitman , and a roar of unsteady laughter went up from [the deck of the ' [We]1127-we 're Here]2674-the deck of the ' we 're here ' . "[400-jason] Hedn't [you]1131-you ' baout 's well send [the old man]1812-the old man aboard ? [We]1127-we 're runnin ' in fer more bait an ' graound - tackle . [He]1812-the old man married [[[my]0-i woman]1134-my woman 's aunt]1135-my woman 's aunt . " [Penn]284-penn waked [him]1812-the old man from [his]1812-the old man stupor of despair , and [Tom Platt]274-tom platt rowed [him]1812-the old man over . [He]1812-the old man went away without a word of thanks , not knowing what was to come ; and the fog closed over all . "[1812-the old man] And now , " said [Penn]284-penn , drawing a deep breath as though about to preach . "[1812-the old man] And now " - the erect body sank like a sword driven home into the scabbard ; the light faded from the overbright eyes ; the voice returned to its usual pitiful little titter - "[1812-the old man] and now , " said [Pennsylvania Pratt]363-pennsylvania pratt , "[1812-the old man] do [you]1131-you think it 's too early for a little game of checkers , [Mr. Salters]285-salters ? " "[1131-you] The very thing - the very thing [I]0-i was goin' to say [myself]0-i , " cried [Salters]285-salters promptly . " [The little fellow]2675-the little fellow blushed and meekly followed [Salters]285-salters forward . "[284-penn] Up anchor ! Hurry ! " said [Long Jack]273-long jack , when [they]1142-they were working through the fog once more , damp , dripping , and bewildered . " [They]1142-they decided that [Disko]263-disko was entirely correct . " "[284-penn] Asleep - dead asleep . Turned in like [a child]2225-a child , " [Salters]285-salters replied , tiptoeing aft .
