[Jason]400-jason was tur'ble praoud of [[his]400-jason boy]1150-his boy , an ' [I]0-i mistrusted all along ' twas a jedgment on worshippin ' [vain idols]1151-vain idols . " "[0-i] There 's others jes as sot , " said [Disko]263-disko . "[0-i] That 's difrunt , " [Salters]285-salters retorted quickly . "[284-penn] [Penn]284-penn 's not all caulked , an ' [I]0-i ai n't only but doin' [my]0-i duty by [him]284-penn . " [They]2676-they waited , [those hungry men]2677-those hungry men , three hours , till [Penn]284-penn reappeared with a smooth face and a blank mind . [He]284-penn said [he]284-penn believed that [he]284-penn had been dreaming . Then [he]284-penn wanted to know why [they]2676-they were so silent , and [they]2676-they could not tell [him]284-penn . [Disko]263-disko worked all hands mercilessly for the next three or four days ; and when [they]2676-they could not go out , turned [them]2676-they into the hold to stack [the ship]1851-the ship 's stores into smaller compass , to make more room for the fish . The packed mass ran from the cabin partition to the sliding door behind the foc'sle stove ; and [Disko]263-disko showed how there is great art in stowing cargo so as to bring [a schooner]779-a schooner to [her]779-a schooner best draft . [The crew]728-the crew were thus kept lively till [they]728-the crew recovered [their]728-the crew spirits ; and [Harvey]250-harvey was tickled with a rope 's end by [Long Jack]273-long jack for being , as [the Galway man]605-the galway man said , ' sorrowful as a sick cat over fwhat could n't be helped . "[1152-he] [He]1152-he did a great deal of thinking in those weary days , and told [Dan]260-dan what [he]1152-he thought , and [Dan]260-dan agreed with [him]1152-he - even to the extent of asking for fried pies instead of hooking them . But a week later [the two]926-the two nearly upset [the Hattie]294-hattie S. in a wild attempt to stab a shark with an old bayonet tied to a stick . [The grim brute]1154-the grim brute rubbed alongside the dory begging for small fish , and between [the three of [them]926-the two]1155-the three of them it was a mercy [they]926-the two all got off alive . At last , after playing [blindman's - buff in the fog]1156-blindman's - buff in the fog , there came a morning when [Disko]263-disko shouted down [the foc'sle]808-the foc'sle : " Hurry , [boys]2074-boys ! [We]926-the two 're in taown ! "[263-disko] CHAPTER VIII To the end of [his]1152-he days , [Harvey]250-harvey will never forget that sight . The sun was just clear of the horizon [they]926-the two had not seen for nearly a week , and [his]1152-he low red light struck into the riding - sails of three fleets of [anchored schooners]1158-anchored schooners - one to the north , one to the westward , and one to the south . There must have been nearly a hundred of [them]1159-them , of every possible make and build , with , far away , [a square - rigged Frenchman]1160-a square - rigged frenchman , all bowing and courtesying one to the other . From [every boat]1161-every boat [dories]1162-dories were dropping away like bees from a crowded hive , and the clamour of voices , the rattling of ropes and blocks , and the splash of the oars carried for miles across the heaving water . The sails turned all colours , black , pearly - gray , and white , as the sun mounted ; and [more boats]1163-more boats swung up through the mists to the southward . [The dories]552-the dories gathered in clusters , separated , reformed , and broke again , all heading one way ; while [men]2279-men hailed and whistled and cat - called and sang , and [the water]585-the water was speckled with rubbish thrown overboard . " It 's [a town]2683-a town , "[250-harvey] said [Harvey]250-harvey . " [Disko]263-disko was right . It IS [a town]2683-a town ! "[250-harvey] " [I]263-disko 've seen smaller , "[263-disko] said [Disko]263-disko . " There 's about [a thousand men]2685-a thousand men [here]1800-here ; an ' yonder 's [the Virgin]46-the virgin . "[263-disko] [He]263-disko pointed to [a vacant space of greenish sea]1167-a vacant space of greenish sea , where there were [no dories]1168-no dories . The ' [We]1169-we 're Here ' skirted round [the northern squadron]1170-the northern squadron , [Disko]263-disko waving [his]263-disko hand to [friend]1171-friend after [friend]1171-friend , and anchored as nearly as [a racing yacht]1173-a racing yacht at the end of the season . [The Bank fleet]1174-the bank fleet pass good seamanship in silence ; but [a bungler]1175-a bungler is jeered all along the line . " Jest in time fer [the caplin]2687-the caplin , "[403-the mary chilton] cried [the Mary Chilton]403-the mary chilton . " ' Salt ' most wet ? "[404-the king philip] asked [the King Philip]404-the king philip . " Hey , [Tom Platt]274-tom platt ! Come t ' supper to - night ? "[405-the henry clay] said [the Henry Clay]405-the henry clay ; and so questions and answers flew back and forth . [Men]2279-men had met [one another]1177-one another before , dory - fishing in the fog , and there is no place for gossip like [the Bank fleet]1174-the bank fleet . [They]2279-men all seemed to know about [Harvey]250-harvey 's rescue , and asked if [he]250-harvey were worth [his]250-harvey salt yet . [The young bloods]1179-the young bloods jested with [Dan]260-dan , who had a lively tongue of [his]260-dan own , and inquired after [their]1179-the young bloods health by the town - nicknames [they]1179-the young bloods least liked . [[Manuel]272-manuel 's countrymen]1180-manuel 's countrymen jabbered at [him]272-manuel in [their]1180-manuel 's countrymen own language ; and even [the silent cook]1181-the silent cook was seen riding the jib - boom and shouting Gaelic to [a friend]828-a friend as black as [himself]1181-the silent cook . After [they]1179-the young bloods had buoyed the cable - all around [the Virgin]46-the virgin is [rocky bottom]2612-rocky bottom , and carelessness means chafed ground - tackle and danger from drifting - after [they]1179-the young bloods had buoyed the cable , [[their]1179-the young bloods dories]1184-their dories went forth to join the mob of [boats]2466-boats anchored about a mile away . [The schooners]1186-the schooners rocked and dipped at a safe distance , like mother ducks watching [their]1186-the schooners brood , while [the dories]552-the dories behaved like mannerless ducklings . As [they]1179-the young bloods drove into the confusion , boat banging [boat]1188-boat , [Harvey]250-harvey 's ears tingled at the comments on [his]250-harvey rowing . Every dialect from [Labrador]133-labrador to [Long Island]33-long island , with Portuguese , [Neapolitan]134-neapolitan , Lingua Franca , French , and Gaelic , with songs and shoutings and new oaths , rattled round [him]250-harvey , and [he]250-harvey seemed to be the butt of it all . For the first time in [his]250-harvey life [he]250-harvey felt shy - perhaps that came from living so long with only the ' [We]1189-we 're Heres ' - among the scores of wild faces that rose and fell with [the reeling small craft]1190-the reeling small craft . [A gentle , breathing swell , three furlongs from trough to barrel]1191-a gentle , breathing swell , three furlongs from trough to barrel , would quietly shoulder up a string of variously painted dories . [They]1179-the young bloods hung for an instant , a wonderful frieze against the sky - line , and [[their]1179-the young bloods men]1192-their men pointed and hailed . Next moment the open mouths , waving arms , and bare chests disappeared , while on another swell came up an entirely new line of characters like paper figures in a toy theatre . So [Harvey]250-harvey stared . " Watch out ! "[260-dan] said [Dan]260-dan , flourishing a dip - net " When [I]260-dan tell [you]250-harvey dip , [you]250-harvey dip . The caplin'll school any time from naow on . Where 'll [we]1198-we lay , [Tom Platt]274-tom platt ? "[260-dan] Pushing , shoving , and hauling , greeting [old friends]1193-old friends here and warning [old enemies there]1194-old enemies there , [Commodore Tom Platt]274-tom platt led [[his]274-tom platt little fleet]1195-his little fleet well to leeward of [the general crowd]1196-the general crowd , and immediately [three or four men]1197-three or four men began to haul on [their]1197-three or four men anchors with intent to lee - bow the ' [We]1198-we 're Heres ' . But a yell of laughter went up as a dory shot from [[her]1199-her station]1200-her station with exceeding speed , its occupant pulling madly on the roding . " Give [her]1199-her slack ! "[1201-twenty voices] roared [twenty voices]1201-twenty voices . " Let [him]274-tom platt shake it out . "[1201-twenty voices] " What 's the matter ? "[250-harvey] said [Harvey]250-harvey , as [the boat]528-the boat flashed away to the southward . " [He]274-tom platt 's anchored , is n't [he]274-tom platt ? "[250-harvey] " Anchored , sure enough , but [his]274-tom platt graound - tackle 's kinder shifty , "[260-dan] said [Dan]260-dan , laughing . " [Whale]53-the whale 's fouled it . . . . Dip Harve ! Here [they]53-the whale come ! "[260-dan] [The sea]1855-the sea round [them]1204-them clouded and darkened , and then frizzed up in showers of tiny silver fish , and over a space of five or six acres the cod began to leap like trout in May ; while behind the cod three or four broad gray - backs broke the water into boils . Then [everybody]1205-everybody shouted and tried to haul up [his]1205-everybody anchor to get among [the school]1206-the school , and fouled [[his]1205-everybody neighbour]1207-his neighbour 's line and said what was in [his]1205-everybody heart , and dipped furiously with [his]1205-everybody dip - net , and shrieked cautions and advice to [[his]1205-everybody companions]1208-his companions , while [the deep]1209-the deep fizzed like freshly opened soda - water , and cod , [men]2279-men , and whales together flung in upon the luckless bait . [Harvey]250-harvey was nearly knocked overboard by the handle of [Dan]260-dan 's net . But in all the wild tumult [he]250-harvey noticed , and never forgot , the wicked , set little eye - something like a circus elephant 's eye - of a whale that drove along almost level with the water , and , so [he]250-harvey said , winked at [him]250-harvey . [Three boats]1211-three boats found [their]1211-three boats rodings fouled by [these reckless mid - sea hunters]1212-these reckless mid - sea hunters , and were towed half a mile ere [their]1211-three boats horses shook the line free . Then the caplin moved off , and five minutes later there was no sound except the splash of the sinkers overside , the flapping of the cod , and the whack of the muckles as [the men]1868-the men stunned [them]1211-three boats . It was wonderful fishing . [Harvey]250-harvey could see the glimmering cod below , swimming slowly in droves , biting as steadily as [they]1211-three boats swam . Bank law strictly forbids more than one hook on one line when [the dories]552-the dories are on [the Virgin]46-the virgin or [the Eastern Shoals]102-the eastern shoals ; but so close lay [the boats]1991-the boats that even single hooks snarled , and [Harvey]250-harvey found [himself]250-harvey in hot argument with [a gentle , hairy Newfoundlander]1216-a gentle , hairy newfoundlander on one side and [a howling Portuguese]1217-a howling portuguese on the other . Worse than any tangle of fishing - lines was the confusion of the dory - rodings below water . [Each man]775-each man had anchored where it seemed good to [him]775-each man , drifting and rowing round [his]775-each man fixed point . As the fish struck on less quickly , [each man]775-each man wanted to haul up and get to better ground ; but [every third man]1220-every third man found [himself]1220-every third man intimately connected with [some four or five neighbours]1221-some four or five neighbours . To cut another 's roding is crime unspeakable on [the Banks]44-the banks ; yet it was done , and done without detection , three or four times that day . [Tom Platt]274-tom platt caught [a Maine man in the black act]1222-a maine man in the black act and knocked [him]1222-a maine man in the black act over the gunwale with an oar , and [Manuel]272-manuel served [a fellow - countryman]1223-a fellow - countryman in the same way . But [Harvey]250-harvey 's anchor - line was cut , and so was [Penn]284-penn 's , and [they]1224-they were turned into relief - boats to carry fish to [the ' [We]1226-we 're Here]1225-the ' we 're here ' as [the dories]552-the dories filled . [The caplin]2687-the caplin schooled once more at twilight , when the mad clamour was repeated ; and at dusk [they]1224-they rowed back to dress down by the light of kerosene - lamps on the edge of the pen . It was a huge pile , and [they]1224-they went to sleep while [they]1224-they were dressing . Next day [several boats]1229-several boats fished right above [the cap of [the Virgin]46-the virgin]1230-the cap of the virgin ; and [Harvey]250-harvey , with [them]1224-they , looked down on the very weed of that lonely rock , which rises to within twenty feet of the surface . [The cod]1231-the cod were there in legions , marching solemnly over the leathery kelp . When [they]1224-they bit , [they]1224-they bit all together ; and so when [they]1224-they stopped . There was a slack time at noon , and [the dories]552-the dories began to search for amusement . It was [Dan]260-dan who sighted [the Hope Of [Prague]301-prague]135-the hope of prague just coming up , and as [[her]1233-her boats]1234-her boats joined [the company]503-the company [they]1224-they were greeted with the question : " Who 's [the meanest man in the Fleet]2688-the meanest man in the fleet ? "[1236-three hundred voices] [Three hundred voices]1236-three hundred voices answered cheerily : " [Nick Bra - ady]407-nick bra - ady . "[1236-three hundred voices] It sounded like an organ chant . " Who stole the lampwicks ? "[1236-three hundred voices] That was [Dan]260-dan 's contribution . " [Nick Bra - ady]407-nick bra - ady , "[1238-an unknown backbiter] sang [the boats]1991-the boats . " Who biled the salt bait fer soup ? "[1238-an unknown backbiter] This was [an unknown backbiter]1238-an unknown backbiter a quarter of a mile away . Again the joyful chorus . Now , [Brady]302-nick brady was not especially mean , but [he]302-nick brady had that reputation , and [the Fleet]2092-the fleet made the most of it . Then [they]1224-they discovered [a man from [a Truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks]1240-a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - [a ' scrowger]1241-a ' scrowger , " [they]1224-they call it - in [the Shoals]104-the shoals]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals . Naturally , [he]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals had been christened "[1241-a ' scrowger] [Scrowger Jim]408-jim " ; and though [he]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals had hidden [himself]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals on [the Georges]356-georges ever since , [he]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals found [his]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals honours waiting for [him]2689-a man from a truro boat who , six years before , had been convicted of using a tackle with five or six hooks - a ' scrowger , " they call it - in the shoals full blown . [They]1224-they took it up in a sort of firecracker chorus : "[408-jim] [Jim]408-jim ! [O Jim]408-jim ! [Jim]408-jim ! [O Jim]408-jim ! Sssscrowger [Jim]408-jim ! " That pleased [everybody]1205-everybody . Then [they]1224-they had to ask [that Beverly man]2693-that beverly man how [he]2691-a poetical beverly man was off for beans , because even [poets]2694-poets must not have things all [their]2694-poets own way . [Every schooner]2695-every schooner and nearly [every man]2696-every man got it in turn . Was there [a careless or dirty cook]2697-a careless or dirty cook anywhere ? Had [a man]504-a man hooked tobacco from a mess - mate ? [He]504-a man was named in meeting ; the name tossed from roller to roller . [Disko]263-disko 's infallible judgments , [[Long Jack]273-long jack 's market - boat that [he]273-long jack had sold years ago]2701-long jack 's market - boat that he had sold years ago , [Dan]260-dan 's sweetheart oh , but [Dan]260-dan was [an angry boy]2702-an angry boy ! , [Penn]284-penn 's bad luck with [dory - anchors]2703-dory - anchors , [Salter]409-salter 's views on manure , [Manuel]272-manuel 's little slips from virtue ashore , and [Harvey]250-harvey 's ladylike handling of the oar - all were laid before [the public]2704-the public ; and as the fog fell around [them]552-the dories in silvery sheets beneath the sun , the voices sounded like a bench of [invisible judges pronouncing sentence]2705-invisible judges pronouncing sentence . [The dories]552-the dories roved and fished and squabbled till a swell underran [the sea]1855-the sea . Then [they]552-the dories drew more apart to save [their]552-the dories sides , and [some one]707-some one called that if the swell continued [the Virgin]2533-the virgin would break . [A reckless Galway man with [[his]2710-a reckless galway man with his nephew nephew]2711-his nephew]2710-a reckless galway man with his nephew denied this , hauled up anchor , and rowed over [the very rock]2712-the very rock itself . Many voices called [them]552-the dories to come away , while [others]2051-others dared [them]552-the dories to hold on . As the smooth - backed rollers passed to the southward , [they]552-the dories hove the dory high and high into the mist , and dropped [her]2711-his nephew in ugly , sucking , dimpled water , where [she]2711-his nephew spun round [her]2711-his nephew anchor , within a foot or two of [the hidden rock]2714-the hidden rock . It was playing with death for mere bravado ; and [the boats]1991-the boats looked on in uneasy silence till [Long Jack]273-long jack rowed up behind [[his]273-long jack countrymen]2716-his countrymen and quietly cut [their]2716-his countrymen roding . " [The men]1868-the men swore and tried to argue as [the boat]528-the boat drifted ; but the next swell checked a little , like [a man tripping on a carpet]2719-a man tripping on a carpet . There was a deep sob and a gathering roar , and [the Virgin]2533-the virgin flung up a couple of acres of foaming water , white , furious , and ghastly over [the shoal sea]2721-the shoal sea . Then [all the boats]2722-all the boats greatly applauded [Long Jack]273-long jack , and [the Galway men]2723-the galway men held [their]2723-the galway men tongue . "[1242-you] Ai n't it elegant ? The fun was spoilt when the rock spoke again , a half - mile to windward , and the tormented bark set everything that would draw and went [her]1815-his wife ways ; but [the dories]552-the dories felt that the honours lay with [them]552-the dories . All that night [the Virgin]371-the virgin roared hoarsely ; and next morning , over [an angry , white - headed sea]2753-an angry , white - headed sea , [Harvey]250-harvey saw the Fleet with flickering masts waiting for a lead . [The boys]703-the boys stood by the dory - tackles with lanterns , [the men]1868-the men ready to haul , one eye cocked for the sweeping wave that would make [them]552-the dories drop everything and hold on for dear life . " "[250-harvey] Heaving 'em overboard , " said [Harvey]250-harvey . "[250-harvey] What for ? [We]1288-we sha'n't eat 'em . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't care . [I]0-i had to look at [his]1284-the thing face while [I]0-i was takin ' the belt off . [You]250-harvey can keep [your]250-harvey catch if [you]250-harvey like . [I]0-i 've no use for [mine]0-i . " [Dan]260-dan said nothing , but threw [his]260-dan fish over again . "[0-i] Guess it 's best to be on the safe side , " [he]0-i murmured at last . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'd give a month 's pay if this fog ' u'd lift . Things go abaout in a fog that [ye]250-harvey do n't see in clear weather - [yo]1294-yo - hoes an ' hollerers and such like . [I]0-i 'm sorter relieved [he]1284-the thing come the way [he]1284-the thing did instid o ' walkin ' . [He]1284-the thing might ha ' walked . " "[1284-the thing] Do n't , [Dan]260-dan ! [We]1295-we 're right on top of [him]1284-the thing now . ' Wish [I]0-i was safe aboard , hem ' pounded by [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters . " "[276-uncle salters] [They]1296-they 'll be lookin ' fer [us]1295-we in a little . Gimme the tooter . " [Dan]260-dan took the tin dinner - horn , but paused before [he]260-dan blew . "[276-uncle salters] Go on , " said [Harvey]250-harvey . "[276-uncle salters] [I]0-i do n't want to stay here all night " "[1284-the thing] Question is , haow [he]1284-the thing 'd take it . There was [a man frum down [the coast]859-the coast]1297-a man frum down the coast told [me]0-i once [he]1284-the thing was in [a schooner where [they]1296-they darsen't ever blow a horn to [the dories]552-the dories]1299-a schooner where they darsen't ever blow a horn to the dories , becaze [the skipper]579-the skipper - not [the man [he]1284-the thing was with]1302-the man he was with , but [a captain that had run [her]579-the skipper five years before]1303-a captain that had run her five years before - [he]1284-the thing 'd drowned [a boy]2079-a boy alongside in a drunk fit ; an ' ever after , [that boy [he]1284-the thing 'd row along - side too and shout , ' [Dory]398-dory ! dory]1305-that boy he 'd row along - side too and shout , ' dory ! dory ! ' with the rest . " "[398-dory] [Dory]398-dory ! dory ! " a muffled voice cried through the fog . [They]1296-they cowered again , and the horn dropped from [Dan]260-dan 's hand . "[398-dory] Hold on ! " cried [Harvey]250-harvey ; "[628-the cook] it 's [the cook]628-the cook . " "[628-the cook] Dunno what made [me]0-i think o ' thet fool tale , either , " said [Dan]260-dan . "[0-i] It 's [the doctor]2318-the doctor , sure enough . " "[260-dan] [Dan]260-dan ! [Danny]260-dan ! Oooh , [Dan]260-dan ! Harve ! [Harvey]250-harvey ! Oooh , [Haarveee]414-haarveee ! " "[414-haarveee] [We]1308-we 're here , " sung [both boys]2807-both boys together . [They]2807-both boys heard oars , but could see nothing till [the cook , shining and dripping]2808-the cook , shining and dripping , rowed into [them]2807-both boys . "[1308-we] What iss happened ? " said [he]628-the cook . "[260-dan] [You]260-dan will be beaten at [home]545-home . " "[260-dan] Thet 's what [we]1308-we want . Thet 's what [we]1308-we 're sufferin ' for " said [Dan]260-dan . "[260-dan] Anything homey 's good enough fer [us]1308-we . [We]1308-we 've had kinder depressin ' company . " As [the cook]628-the cook passed [them]2807-both boys a line , [Dan]260-dan told [him]628-the cook the tale . "[1308-we] Yess ! [He]1310-he come for hiss knife , " was all [he]260-dan said at the end . Never had the little rocking ' [We]1308-we 're Here ' looked so deliciously [home]545-home - like as when [the cook , born and bred in fogs]2811-the cook , born and bred in fogs , rowed [them]2807-both boys back to [her]628-the cook . There was a warm glow of light from [the cabin]569-the cabin and a satisfying smell of food forward , and it was heavenly to hear [Disko]263-disko and [the others]620-the others , [all quite alive and solid]2814-all quite alive and solid , leaning over the rail and promising [them]2807-both boys a first - class pounding . But [the cook]628-the cook was [a black ; master of strategy]2816-a black ; master of strategy . [He]260-dan did not get the dories aboard till [he]260-dan had given the more striking points of the tale , explaining as [he]260-dan backed and bumped round the counter how [Harvey]250-harvey was [the mascot]2817-the mascot to destroy any possible bad luck . So [the boys]703-the boys came override as [rather uncanny heroes]2819-rather uncanny heroes , and [every one]2820-every one asked [them]703-the boys questions instead of pounding [them]703-the boys for making trouble . [Little Penn]284-penn delivered quite a speech on the folly of superstitions ; but public opinion was against [him]284-penn and in favour of [Long Jack]273-long jack , who told the most excruciating ghost - stories , till nearly midnight . Under that influence [no one]1898-no one except [Salters]276-uncle salters and [Penn]284-penn said anything about "[1310-he] idolatry , " when [the cook]628-the cook put a lighted candle , a cake of flour and water , and a pinch of salt on a shingle , and floated [them]703-the boys out astern to keep [the Frenchman]289-frenchman of anguille quiet in case [he]284-penn was still restless . [Dan]260-dan lit the candle because [he]260-dan had bought the belt , and [the cook]628-the cook grunted and muttered charms as long as [he]628-the cook could see the ducking point of flame . Said [Harvey]250-harvey to [Dan]260-dan , as [they]2824-we turned in after watch : "[1310-he] How about progress and Catholic superstitions ? " "[1310-he] Huh ! [I]0-i guess [I]0-i 'm as enlightened and progressive as [the next man]1826-the next man , but when it comes to a dead St. [Malo]415-malo deck - hand scarin ' [a couple o ' pore boys]1312-a couple o ' pore boys stiff fer the sake of a thirty - cent knife , why , then , [the cook]628-the cook can take hold fer all o ' [me]0-i . [I]0-i mistrust [furriners]1314-furriners , livin ' or dead . " Next morning all , except [the cook]628-the cook , were rather ashamed of the ceremonies , and went to work double tides , speaking gruffly to [one another]1177-one another . The ' [We]2824-we 're Here ' was racing neck and neck for [her]628-the cook last few loads against [the Parry Norman]416-the parry norman ; and so close was the struggle that [the Fleet]2092-the fleet took side and betted tobacco . [All hands]2828-all hands worked at the lines or dressing - down till [they]2828-all hands fell asleep where [they]2828-all hands stood - beginning before dawn and ending when it was too dark to see . [They]2828-all hands even used [the cook]628-the cook as [pitcher]2830-pitcher , and turned [Harvey]250-harvey into [the hold]648-the hold to pass salt , while [Dan]260-dan helped to dress down . Luckily [a Parry Norman man]2832-a parry norman man sprained [his]2832-a parry norman man ankle falling down the foc'sle , and the ' [We]2824-we 're Heres ' gained . [Harvey]250-harvey could not see how one more fish could be crammed into [her]628-the cook , but [Disko]263-disko and [Tom Platt]274-tom platt stowed and stowed , and planked the mass down with big stones from the ballast , and there was always "[0-i] jest another day 's work . " [Disko]263-disko did not tell [them]2828-all hands when all the salt was wetted . [He]263-disko rolled to [the lazarette aft [the cabin]569-the cabin]2833-the lazarette aft the cabin and began hauling out the big mainsail . This was at ten in the morning . The riding - sail was down and the main- and topsail were up by noon , and [dories]1162-dories came alongside with letters for [home]545-home , envying [their]1162-dories good fortune . At last [she]628-the cook cleared [decks]2837-decks , hoisted [her]628-the cook flag , - as is the right of [the first boat off [the Banks]44-the banks]2838-the first boat off the banks , - up - anchored , and began to move . [Disko]263-disko pretended that [he]263-disko wished to accomodate folk who had not sent in [their]1162-dories mail , and so worked [her]628-the cook gracefully in and out among [the schooners]1186-the schooners . In reality , that was [his]263-disko little triumphant procession , and for the fifth year running it showed what kind of [mariner]2840-mariner [he]263-disko was . [Dan]260-dan 's accordion and [Tom Platt]274-tom platt 's fiddle supplied the music of the magic verse [you]1316-your must not sing till all the salt is wet : "[0-i] Hih ! Yih ! [Yoho]1315-yoho ! Send [your]1316-your letters raound ! All [our]1317-we salt is wetted , an ' the anchor 's off the graound ! Bend , oh , bend [your]1316-your mains'l , [we]1317-we 're back to [Yankeeland]142-yankeeland - With fifteen hunder ' quintal , An ' fifteen hunder ' quintal , ' [Teen hunder]417-teen hunder ' toppin ' quintal , ' Twix ' old ' Queereau an ' Grand . " The last letters pitched on [deck]1866-deck wrapped round pieces of coal , and [the Gloucester men]2842-the gloucester men shouted messages to [[their]2842-the gloucester men wives]2843-their wives and [womenfolks]2844-womenfolks and [owners]2845-owners , while the ' [We]1317-we 're Here ' finished the musical ride through [the Fleet]2092-the fleet , [her]2847-she headsails quivering like [a man]504-a man 's hand when [he]504-a man raises it to say good - by . [Harvey]250-harvey very soon discovered that the ' [We]1317-we 're Here ' , with [her]2847-she riding - sail , strolling from [berth]2460-berth to berth , and the ' [We]1317-we 're Here ' headed west by south under [home canvas]2850-home canvas , were [two very different boats]2851-two very different boats . There was a bite and kick to the wheel even in "[2073-boy] [boy]2073-boy 's " weather ; [he]250-harvey could feel the dead weight in the hold flung forward mightily across the surges , and the streaming line of bubbles overside made [his]250-harvey eyes dizzy . [Disko]263-disko kept [them]1317-we busy fiddling with the sails ; and when those were flattened like [a racing yacht]1173-a racing yacht 's , [Dan]260-dan had to wait on the big topsail , which was put over by hand every time [she]2847-she went about . In spare moments [they]1317-we pumped , for the packed fish dripped brine , which does not improve a cargo . But since there was no fishing , [Harvey]250-harvey had time to look at [the sea]1855-the sea from another point of view . The low - sided schooner was naturally on most intimate terms with [her]2847-she surroundings . [They]1317-we saw little of the horizon save when [she]2847-she topped a swell ; and usually [she]2847-she was elbowing , fidgeting , and coasting [her]2847-she steadfast way through gray , gray - blue , or black hollows laced across and across with streaks of shivering foam ; or rubbing [herself]2847-she caressingly along the flank of [some bigger water - hill]2854-some bigger water - hill . It was as if [she]2847-she said : "[2073-boy] [You]1319-you would n't hurt [me]0-i , surely ? [I]0-i 'm only the little ' [We]1320-we 're Here ' . " Then [she]2847-she would slide away chuckling softly to [herself]2847-she till [she]2847-she was brought up by some fresh obstacle . [The dullest of folk]2855-the dullest of folk can not see this kind of thing hour after hour through long days without noticing it ; and [Harvey]250-harvey , being anything but dull , began to comprehend and enjoy the dry chorus of [wave - tops turning over with a sound of incessant tearing]2856-wave - tops turning over with a sound of incessant tearing ; the hurry of the winds working across [open spaces]2857-open spaces and herding the purple - blue cloud - shadows ; the splendid upheaval of the red sunrise ; the folding and packing away of the morning mists , wall after wall withdrawn across the white floors ; the salty glare and blaze of noon ; the kiss of rain falling over thousands of dead , flat square miles ; the chilly blackening of everything at the day 's end ; and the million wrinkles of [the sea]1855-the sea under the moonlight , when the jib - boom solemnly poked at the low stars , and [Harvey]250-harvey went down to get a doughnut from [the cook]628-the cook . But the best fun was when [the boys]703-the boys were put on the wheel together , [Tom Platt]274-tom platt within hail , and [she]2847-she cuddled [her]2847-she lee - rail down to the crashing blue , and kept a little home - made rainbow arching unbroken over [her]2847-she windlass . Then the jaws of the booms whined against the masts , and the sheets creaked , and the sails filled with roaring ; and when [she]2847-she slid into a hollow [she]2847-she trampled like [a woman]2861-a woman tripped in [her]2847-she own silk dress , and came out , [her]2847-she jib wet half - way up , yearning and peering for the tall twin - lights of [Thatcher 's Island]143-thatcher 's island . [They]703-the boys left the cold gray of [the Bank sea]119-the bank , saw [the lumber - ships]2862-the lumber - ships making for [Quebec]109-quebec by [the Straits of]145-the straits of [St. Lawrence]146-st. lawrence , with [the Jersey salt - brigs from [Spain]147-spain and [Sicily]148-sicily]2863-the jersey salt - brigs from spain and sicily ; found [a friendly northeaster off [Artimon Bank]149-artimon bank that drove [them]703-the boys within view of [the East light of [Sable Island]27-sable island]2865-the east light of sable island]2864-a friendly northeaster off artimon bank that drove them within view of the east light of sable island , - a sight [Disko]263-disko did not linger over , - and stayed with [them]703-the boys past Western and [Le Have]29-le have , to [the northern fringe of [George]151-george 's]2866-the northern fringe of george 's . From there [they]703-the boys picked up [the deeper water]2867-the deeper water , and let [her]294-hattie go merrily . "[294-hattie] [Hattie]294-hattie 's pulling on the string , " [Dan]260-dan confided to [Harvey]250-harvey . "[294-hattie] [Hattie]294-hattie an ' [Ma]418-ma . Next Sunday [you]418-ma 'll be hirin ' [a boy]2079-a boy to throw water on the windows to make [ye]418-ma go to sleep . ' Guess [you]418-ma 'll keep with [us]1322-we till [[your]418-ma folks]1323-your folks come . Do [you]418-ma know the best of gettin ' [ashore]2232-ashore again ? " "[418-ma] Hot bath ? " said [Harvey]250-harvey . [His]250-harvey eyebrows were all white with dried spray . "[418-ma] That 's good , but a night - shirt 's better . [I]0-i 've been dreamin ' o ' night - shirts ever since [we]1322-we bent [our]1322-we mainsail . [Ye]418-ma can wiggle [your]418-ma toes then . Ma'll hev a new one fer [me]0-i , all washed soft . [It]1325-it 's [home]545-home , Harve . [It]1325-it 's [home]545-home ! [Ye]418-ma can sense it in the air . [We]1322-we 're runnin ' into the aidge of a hot wave naow , an ' [I]0-i can smell the bayberries . Wonder if [we]1322-we 'll get in fer supper . [Port]419-port a trifle . " The hesitating sails flapped and lurched in the close air as the deep smoothed out , blue and oily , round them . When [they]1322-we whistled for a wind only the rain came in spiky rods , bubbling and drumming , and behind the rain the thunder and the lightning of mid - August . [They]1322-we lay on [the deck]517-the deck with bare feet and arms , telling [one another]1177-one another what [they]1322-we would order at [their]1322-we first meal [ashore]2232-ashore ; for now [the land]487-the land was in plain sight . [A Gloucester swordfish - boat]2872-a gloucester swordfish - boat drifted alongside , [a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit]2873-a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit flourished [his]2873-a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit harpoon , [his]2873-a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit bare head plastered down with the wet . "[419-port] And all 's well ! " [he]2873-a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit sang cheerily , as though [he]2873-a man in the little pulpit on the bowsprit were watch on [a big liner]2874-a big liner . "[420-wouverman] [Wouverman]420-wouverman 's waiting fer [you]1328-you , [Disko]263-disko . What 's the news o ' [the Fleet]2092-the fleet ? " [Disko]263-disko shouted it and passed on , while the wild summer storm pounded overhead and the lightning flickered along [the capes]2875-the capes from four different quarters at once . It gave [the low circle of hills round [Gloucester Harbor]152-gloucester harbor]2876-the low circle of hills round gloucester harbor , [Ten Pound Island]2877-ten pound island , [the fish - sheds]2878-the fish - sheds , with the broken line of [house - roofs]2879-house - roofs , and each spar and buoy on [the water]585-the water , in blinding photographs that came and went a dozen times to the minute as the ' [We]1331-we 're Here ' crawled in on half - flood , and [the whistling - buoy]2881-the whistling - buoy moaned and mourned behind [her]2882-her . Then the storm died out in long , separated , vicious dags of blue - white flame , followed by a single roar like the roar of a mortar - battery , and the shaken air tingled under the stars as it got back to silence . "[2092-the fleet] The flag , the flag ! " said [Disko]263-disko , suddenly , pointing upward . "[2092-the fleet] What is ut ? " said [Long Jack]273-long jack . "[261-otto] [Otto]261-otto ! [Ha'af mast]153-ha'af mast . [They]1330-they can see [us]1331-we frum [shore]1332-shore now . " "[1330-they] [I]0-i 'd clean forgot [He]261-otto 's [no folk to [Gloucester]19-gloucester]1333-no folk to gloucester , has [he]261-otto ? " "[261-otto] [Girl]1334-girl [he]261-otto was goin' to be married to this fall . " "[1334-girl] [Mary]403-the mary chilton pity [her]1334-girl ! " said [Long Jack]273-long jack , and lowered the little flag half - mast for the sake of [Otto]261-otto , swept overboard in a gale off [Le Have]89-le have three months before . [Disko]263-disko wiped the wet from [his]263-disko eyes and led the ' [We]1331-we 're Here ' to [[Wouverman]420-wouverman 's wharf]2883-wouverman 's wharf , giving [his]263-disko orders in whispers , while [she]1334-girl swung round moored tugs and [night - watchmen]2884-night - watchmen hailed [her]1334-girl from the ends of inky - black piers . Over and above the darkness and the mystery of the procession , [Harvey]250-harvey could feel [the land]487-the land close round [him]250-harvey once more , with all [[its]487-the land thousands of [people]565-people]2886-its thousands of people asleep , and the smell of earth after rain , and the familiar noise of a switching - engine coughing to [herself]1334-girl in [a freight - yard]2888-a freight - yard ; and all those things made [his]250-harvey heart beat and [his]250-harvey throat dry up as [he]250-harvey stood by the foresheet . [They]1331-we heard the anchor - watch snoring on a lighthouse - tug , nosed into a pocket of darkness where a lantern glimmered on either side ; [somebody]590-somebody waked with a grunt , threw [them]1331-we a rope , and [they]1331-we made fast to [a silent wharf]2890-a silent wharf flanked with [great iron - roofed sheds]2891-great iron - roofed sheds fall of warm emptiness , and lay there without a sound . Then [Harvey]250-harvey sat down by the wheel , and sobbed and sobbed as though [his]250-harvey heart would break , and [a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale]2892-a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale dropped down into [the schooner]553-the schooner and kissed [Dan]260-dan once on the cheek ; for [she]2892-a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale was [[his]250-harvey mother]1807-his mother , and [she]2892-a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale had seen the ' [We]1331-we 're Here ' by the lightning flashes . [She]2892-a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale took no notice of [Harvey]250-harvey till [he]250-harvey had recovered [himself]250-harvey a little and [Disko]263-disko had told [her]2892-a tall woman who had been sitting on a weigh - scale [his]263-disko story . Then [they]1331-we went to [[Disko]263-disko 's house]2895-disko 's house together as the dawn was breaking ; and until [the telegraph office]2896-the telegraph office was open and [he]250-harvey could wire [[his]250-harvey folk]2133-his folk , [Harvey Cheyne]250-harvey was perhaps [the loneliest boy in all [America]22-america]2898-the loneliest boy in all america . But the curious thing was that [Disko]263-disko and [Dan]260-dan seemed to think none the worse of [him]250-harvey for crying . [Wouverman]420-wouverman was not ready for [[Disko]263-disko 's prices]2899-disko 's prices till [Disko]263-disko , sure that [the ' [We]1225-the ' we 're here 're Here]1225-the ' we 're here ' was at least a week ahead of [any other Gloucester boat]2901-any other gloucester boat , had given [him]263-disko a few days to swallow them ; so all hands played about [the streets]2902-the streets , and [Long Jack]273-long jack stopped the Rocky Neck trolley , on principle , as [he]273-long jack said , till [the conductor]2903-the conductor let [him]273-long jack ride free . But [Dan]260-dan went about with [his]260-dan freckled nose in the air , bung - full of mystery and most haughty to [[his]260-dan family]697-his family . "[1334-girl] [Dan]260-dan , [I]0-i 'll hev to lay inter [you]260-dan ef [you]260-dan act this way , " said [Troop]260-dan , pensively . "[260-dan] Sence [we]1335-we 've come ashore this time [you]260-dan 've bin a heap too fresh . " "[260-dan] [I]0-i 'd lay into [him]1336-him naow ef [he]1336-him was [mine]0-i , " said [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters , sourly . [He]276-uncle salters and [Penn]284-penn boarded with [the Troops]2905-the troops . "[1336-him] Oho ! " said [Dan]260-dan , shuffling with the accordion round [the backyard]2906-the backyard , ready to leap the fence if [the enemy]2907-the enemy advanced . "[260-dan] [Dan]260-dan , [you]260-dan 're welcome to [your]260-dan own judgment , but remember [I]0-i 've warned [ye]260-dan . [Your]260-dan own flesh an ' blood ha ' warned [ye]260-dan ! ' Tain't any o ' [my]0-i fault ef [you]260-dan 're mistook , but [I]0-i 'll be on [deck]1866-deck to watch [ye]260-dan . An ' ez fer yeou , [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters , [[Pharaoh]421-pharaoh 's chief butler]1338-pharaoh 's chief butler ai n't in it ' longside o ' [you]260-dan ! [You]260-dan watch aout an ' wait . [You]260-dan 'll be plowed under like [your]260-dan own blamed clover ; but [me]0-i - [Dan Troop]260-dan - [I]0-i 'll flourish like a green bay - tree because [I]0-i warn't stuck on [my]0-i own opinion . " [Disko]263-disko was smoking in all [his]263-disko shore dignity and a pair of beautiful carpet - slippers . "[260-dan] [You]260-dan 're gettin ' ez crazy as [poor Harve]250-harvey . [You]260-dan two go araound gigglin ' an ' squinchin ' an ' kickin ' [each other]2370-each other under the table till there 's no peace in the haouse , " said [he]0-i . "[260-dan] There 's goin' to be [a heap less - fer some folks]1340-a heap less - fer some folks , " [Dan]260-dan replied . "[260-dan] [You]260-dan wait an ' see . " [He]260-dan and [Harvey]250-harvey went out on [the trolley]2908-the trolley to [East Gloucester]132-east gloucester , where [they]2909-they tramped through the bayberry bushes to [the lighthouse]2910-the lighthouse , and lay down on [the big red boulders]2911-the big red boulders and laughed [themselves]2909-they hungry . [Harvey]250-harvey had shown [Dan]260-dan a telegram , and [the two]926-the two swore to keep silence till the shell burst . "[260-dan] [[Harve]1341-his 's [folk]1955-folk]1342-harve 's folk ? " said [Dan]260-dan , with an unruffled face after supper . "[1955-folk] Well , [I]0-i guess [they]1342-harve 's folk do n't amount to much of anything , or [we]1344-we 'd ha ' heard from ['em]1345-'em by naow . [[His]1341-his pop]1346-his pop keeps a kind o ' store out [West]30-west . Maybe [he]1341-his 'll give [you]0-i 's much as five dollars , [Dad]1947-dad . " "[1947-dad] What did [I]0-i tell [ye]0-i ? " said [Salters]276-uncle salters . "[0-i] Do n't sputter over [your]0-i vittles , [Dan]260-dan . " [CHAPTER IX]422-chapter ix Whatever [his]1341-his private sorrows may be , a multimillionaire , like [any other workingman]2913-any other workingman , should keep abreast of [his]1341-his business . [Harvey Cheyne]250-harvey , [senior]2914-senior , had gone [East]2915-east late in June to meet [a woman broken down]2916-a woman broken down , half mad , who dreamed day and night of [[her]2916-a woman broken down son]2917-her son drowning in [the gray seas]2918-the gray seas . [He]250-harvey had surrounded [her]2916-a woman broken down with [doctors]2919-doctors , [trained nurses]2920-trained nurses , [massage - women]2921-massage - women , and even [faith - cure companions]2922-faith - cure companions , but [they]2923-they were useless . [Mrs. Cheyne]262-cheyne lay still and moaned , or talked of [[her]2916-a woman broken down boy]2924-her boy by the hour together to [any one who would listen]2925-any one who would listen . Hope [she]2916-a woman broken down had none , and who could offer it ? All [she]2916-a woman broken down needed was assurance that drowning did not hurt ; and [[her]2916-a woman broken down husband]2926-her husband watched to guard lest [she]2916-a woman broken down should make the experiment . Of [his]250-harvey own sorrow [he]250-harvey spoke little - hardly realized the depth of it till [he]250-harvey caught [himself]250-harvey asking the calendar on [his]250-harvey writing - desk , "[0-i] What 's the use of going on ? " There had always lain a pleasant notion at the back of [his]250-harvey head that , some day , when [he]250-harvey had rounded off everything and [the boy]1817-the boy had left [college]2928-college , [he]250-harvey would take [[his]250-harvey son]1867-his son to [his]250-harvey heart and lead [him]1867-his son into [his]250-harvey possessions . Then [that boy]1809-that boy , [he]250-harvey argued , as [busy fathers]2931-busy fathers do , would instantly become [[his]250-harvey companion]2932-his companion , [partner]2933-partner , and [ally]2934-ally , and there would follow splendid years of great works carried out together - the old head backing the young fire . Now [[his]250-harvey boy]1150-his boy was dead - lost at [sea]2042-sea , as it might have been [a Swede sailor from one of [[Cheyne]262-cheyne 's big teaships]2938-cheyne 's big teaships]2937-a swede sailor from one of cheyne 's big teaships ; [the wife]2939-the wife dying , or worse ; [he]250-harvey [himself]250-harvey was trodden down by platoons of [women]2278-women and [doctors]2919-doctors and [maids]2942-maids and [attendants]2943-attendants ; worried almost beyond endurance by the shift and change of [her]2939-the wife poor restless whims ; hopeless , with no heart to meet [[his]250-harvey many enemies]2944-his many enemies . [He]250-harvey had taken [the wife]2939-the wife to [[his]250-harvey raw new palace in [San Diego]12-san diego]2946-his raw new palace in san diego , where [she]2939-the wife and [[her]2939-the wife people]2947-her people occupied [a wing of great price]2948-a wing of great price , and [Cheyne]262-cheyne , in [a veranda - room]2949-a veranda - room , between [a secretary]2950-a secretary and a typewriter , who was also [a telegraphist]2951-a telegraphist , toiled along wearily from day to day . There was a war of rates among [four Western railroads in which [he]250-harvey was supposed to be interested]2952-four western railroads in which he was supposed to be interested ; a devastating strike had developed in [[his]250-harvey lumber camps in [Oregon]155-oregon]2953-his lumber camps in oregon , and [the legislature of [the State of California]2955-the state of california , which has no love for [its]2954-the legislature of the state of california , which has no love for its makers makers]2954-the legislature of the state of california , which has no love for its makers , was preparing open war against [him]250-harvey . Ordinarily [he]250-harvey would have accepted battle ere it was offered , and have waged a pleasant and unscrupulous campaign . But now [he]250-harvey sat limply , [his]250-harvey soft black hat pushed forward on to [his]250-harvey nose , [his]250-harvey big body shrunk inside [his]250-harvey loose clothes , staring at [his]250-harvey boots or the Chinese junks in [the bay]2956-the bay , and assenting absently to [the secretary]2957-the secretary 's questions as [he]250-harvey opened the Saturday mail . [Cheyne]262-cheyne was wondering how much it would cost to drop everything and pull out . [He]250-harvey carried huge insurances , could buy [himself]250-harvey royal annuities , and between one of [[his]250-harvey places in [Colorado]156-colorado]2958-his places in colorado and [a little society that would do [the wife]2939-the wife good , say in [Washington]157-washington and [the South Carolina islands]2961-the south carolina islands]2959-a little society that would do the wife good , say in washington and the south carolina islands , [a man]504-a man might forget plans that had come to nothing . [Three bold and experienced men]3031-three bold and experienced men - cool , confident , and dry when [they]3031-three bold and experienced men began ; white , quivering , and wet when [they]3031-three bold and experienced men finished [their]3031-three bold and experienced men trick at those terrible wheels - swung [her]262-cheyne over [the great lift from [Albuquerque]176-albuquerque to [Glorietta]188-glorietta and beyond [Springer]189-springer]3032-the great lift from albuquerque to glorietta and beyond springer , up and up to [the Raton Tunnel]3033-the raton tunnel on [the State line]3034-the state line , whence [they]3031-three bold and experienced men dropped rocking into [La Junta]190-la junta , had sight of [the Arkansaw]191-the arkansaw , and tore down the long slope to [Dodge City]192-dodge city , where [Cheyne]262-cheyne took comfort once again from setting [his]3035-his watch an hour ahead . There was very little talk in [the car]3017-the car . [The secretary]2957-the secretary and typewriter sat together on the stamped Spanish - leather cushions by the plate - glass observation - window at the rear end , watching the surge and ripple of the ties crowded back behind [them]3031-three bold and experienced men , and , it is believed , making notes of the scenery . [Cheyne]262-cheyne moved nervously between [his]3035-his own extravagant gorgeousness and the naked necessity of the combination , an unlit cigar in [his]3035-his teeth , till [the pitying crews]3038-the pitying crews forgot that [he]3035-his was [[their]3038-the pitying crews tribal enemy]3039-their tribal enemy , and did [their]3038-the pitying crews best to entertain [him]3035-his . At night the bunched electrics lit up [that distressful palace of all the luxuries]3040-that distressful palace of all the luxuries , and [they]3031-three bold and experienced men fared sumptuously , swinging on through the emptiness of abject desolation . Now [they]3031-three bold and experienced men heard the swish of a water - tank , and the guttural voice of [a Chinaman]3041-a chinaman , the click - clink of hammers that tested the Krupp steel wheels , and the oath of a tramp chased off the rear - platform ; now the solid crash of coal shot into the tender ; and now a beating back of noises as [they]3031-three bold and experienced men flew past [a waiting train]3042-a waiting train . Now [they]3031-three bold and experienced men looked out into great abysses , a trestle purring beneath [their]3031-three bold and experienced men tread , or up to rocks that barred out half the stars . Now scour and [ravine]3043-ravine changed and rolled back to [jagged mountains on the horizon 's edge]3044-jagged mountains on the horizon 's edge , and now broke into hills lower and lower , till at last came [the true plains]3045-the true plains . At [Dodge City]192-dodge city an unknown hand threw in a copy of a [Kansas]193-kansas paper containing some sort of an interview with [Harvey]250-harvey , who had evidently fallen in with [an enterprising reporter]3046-an enterprising reporter , telegraphed on from [Boston]23-boston . [[Towns]3051-towns and [villages]3053-villages]3052-towns and villages were close together now , and [a man]504-a man could feel here that [he]504-a man moved among [people]565-people . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't see the dial , and [my]0-i eyes ache so . What are [we]1381-we doing ? " "[1381-we] The very best [we]1381-we can , [Mama]250-harvey . There 's no sense in getting in before [the Limited]197-the limited . [We]1381-we 'd only have to wait . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't care . [I]0-i want to feel [we]1381-we 're moving . Sit down and tell [me]0-i the miles . " [Cheyne]262-cheyne sat down and read the dial for [her]262-cheyne there were some miles which stand for records to this day , but [the seventy - foot car]3056-the seventy - foot car never changed its long steamer - like roll , moving through the heat with the hum of a giant bee . Yet the speed was not enough for [Mrs. Cheyne]262-cheyne ; and the heat , the remorseless August heat , was making [her]262-cheyne giddy ; the clock - hands would not move , and when , oh , when would [they]1381-we be in [Chicago]162-chicago ? "[1524-my] [Cheyne]438-mr. cheyne was relieved when [Dan]260-dan turned up and accepted with more delight than [he]260-dan was able to put into words . [Mrs. Cheyne]262-cheyne had spoken privately to [the unaccountable Manuel]272-manuel in the matter of [Harvey]250-harvey 's rescue . [He]272-manuel seemed to have no desire for money . "[272-manuel] CHAPTER X But it was otherwise with [the ' [We]1543-we 're [Here 's ' silent cook]1544-here 's ' silent cook]1542-the ' we 're here 's ' silent cook , for [he]272-manuel came up , [his]272-manuel kit in a handkerchief , and boarded the " Constance . "[272-manuel] [Pay]450-pay was no particular object , and [he]272-manuel did not in the least care where [he]272-manuel slept . [His]272-manuel business , as revealed to [him]272-manuel in dreams , was to follow [Harvey]250-harvey for the rest of [his]272-manuel days . [They]1545-they tried argument and , at last , persuasion ; but there is a difference between one Cape Breton and [two Alabama negroes]1546-two alabama negroes , and the matter was referred to [Cheyne]250-harvey by [the cook]628-the cook and [porter]1548-porter . [The millionaire]1549-the millionaire only laughed . [He]1549-the millionaire presumed [Harvey]250-harvey might need [a body - servant]1550-a body - servant some day or other , and was sure that [one volunteer]1551-one volunteer was worth [five hirelings]1552-five hirelings . Let [the man]515-the man stay , therefore ; even though [he]515-the man called [himself]515-the man [MacDonald]451-macdonald and swore in Gaelic . " [Cheyne]250-harvey pulled [his]250-harvey beard and smiled as [he]250-harvey looked over [the still water]3217-the still water , and spoke away from [Harvey]250-harvey , who presently began to be aware that [[his]250-harvey father]1810-his father was telling the story of [his]250-harvey life . [He]250-harvey talked in a low , even voice , without gesture and without expression ; and it was a history for which [a dozen leading journals]3219-a dozen leading journals would cheerfully have paid many dollars - the story of forty years that was at the same time the story of [the New West]219-the new west [, whose story is yet to be written]3220-, whose story is yet to be written . It began with [a kinless boy]3221-a kinless boy turned loose in [Texas]220-texas , and went on fantastically through a hundred changes and chops of life , the scenes shifting from [State]3222-state after [Western State]221-western state , from [cities that sprang up]3223-cities that sprang up in a month and - in a season utterly withered away , to wild ventures in [wilder camps that are now laborious , paved municipalities]3224-wilder camps that are now laborious , paved municipalities . It covered the building of [three railroads]3225-three railroads and the deliberate wreck of a fourth . It told of [steamers]2552-steamers , [townships]3227-townships , [forests]3228-forests , and [mines]3229-mines , and [the men of [every nation under [heaven]3232-heaven]3231-every nation under heaven , manning , creating , hewing , and digging these]3230-the men of every nation under heaven , manning , creating , hewing , and digging these . It touched on chances of gigantic wealth flung before eyes that could not see , or missed by the merest accident of time and travel ; and through the mad shift of things , sometimes on horseback , more often afoot , now rich , now poor , in and out , and back and forth , deck - hand , train - hand , [contractor]3233-contractor , [boarding - house keeper]3234-boarding - house keeper , [journalist]3235-journalist , [engineer]3236-engineer , [drummer]3237-drummer , [real - estate agent]3238-real - estate agent , [politician , dead - beat , rum - seller]3239-politician , dead - beat , rum - seller , [mine - owner]3240-mine - owner , [speculator]3241-speculator , [cattle - man]3242-cattle - man , or tramp , moved [Harvey Cheyne]250-harvey , alert and quiet , seeking [his]250-harvey own ends , and , so [he]250-harvey said , the glory and advancement of [[his]250-harvey country]3243-his country . [He]250-harvey told of the faith that never deserted [him]250-harvey even when [he]250-harvey hung on the ragged edge of despair - the faith that comes of knowing [men]2279-men and things . [He]250-harvey enlarged , as though [he]250-harvey were talking to [himself]250-harvey , on [his]250-harvey very great courage and resource at all times . The thing was so evident in [the man]515-the man 's mind that [he]250-harvey never even changed [his]250-harvey tone . [He]250-harvey described how [he]250-harvey had bested [[his]250-harvey enemies]2989-his enemies , or forgiven [them]2989-his enemies , exactly as [they]2989-his enemies had bested or forgiven [him]250-harvey in those careless days ; how [he]250-harvey had entreated , cajoled , and bullied [towns]3051-towns , [companies]3248-companies , and [syndicates]3249-syndicates , all for [their]2989-his enemies enduring good ; crawled round , through , or under [mountains and ravines]3250-mountains and ravines , dragging a string and hoop - iron railroad after [him]250-harvey , and in the end , how [he]250-harvey had sat still while promiscuous communities tore the last fragments of [his]250-harvey character to shreds . The tale held [Harvey]250-harvey almost breathless , [his]250-harvey head a little cocked to one side , [his]250-harvey eyes fixed on [[his]250-harvey father]1810-his father 's face , as the twilight deepened and the red cigar - end lit up the furrowed cheeks and heavy eyebrows . It seemed to [him]250-harvey like watching [a locomotive]3252-a locomotive storming across [country]3253-country in the dark - a mile between each glare of the open fire - door : but [this locomotive]3254-this locomotive could talk , and the words shook and stirred [the boy]1817-the boy to the core of [his]250-harvey soul . At last [Cheyne]250-harvey pitched away the cigar - butt , and [the two]926-the two sat in the dark over the lapping water . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've never told that to [any one]562-any one before , " said [the father]770-the father . [Harvey]250-harvey gasped . "[0-i] It 's just the greatest thing that ever was ! " said [he]0-i . "[0-i] That 's what [I]0-i got . Now [I]0-i 'm coming to what [I]0-i did n't get . It wo n't sound much of anything to [you]1631-you , but [I]0-i do n't wish [you]1631-you to be as old as [I]0-i am before [you]1631-you find out . [I]0-i 've picked up as [I]0-i went along , and [I]0-i guess it sticks out all over [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 've never seen it , " said [the son]3201-the son , indignantly . "[0-i] [You]1631-you will , though , [Harve]250-harvey . [You]1631-you will - just as soon as [you]1631-you 're through college . Do n't [I]0-i know it ? Do n't [I]0-i know the look on [men]2279-men 's faces when [they]2279-men think [me]0-i a - a ' mucker , ' as [they]2279-men call it out here ? [I]0-i do n't say [they]2279-men 're ' way ' way up , but [I]0-i feel [I]0-i 'm ' way , ' way , ' way off , somehow . Now [you]1631-you 've got [your]1631-you chance . [You]1631-you 've got to soak up all the learning that 's around , and [you]1631-you 'll live with [a crowd that are doing the same thing]1637-a crowd that are doing the same thing . [They]1637-a crowd that are doing the same thing 'll be doing it for a few thousand dollars a year at most ; but remember [you]1631-you 'll be doing it for millions . [You]1631-you 'll learn law enough to look after [[your]1631-you own property]1638-your own property when [I]0-i 'm out o ' the light , and [you]1631-you 'll have to be solid with [the best men in the market]1639-the best men in the market [they]1639-the best men in the market are useful later ; and above all , [you]1631-you 'll have to stow away the plain , common , sit - down - with - [your]1631-you chin - on [your]1631-you - elbows book - learning . " "[1631-you] There 's no sugar in [my]0-i end of the deal , " said [Harvey]250-harvey . "[1631-you] Four years at college ! Think it over , and let [me]0-i know in the morning . Hurry ! [We]1640-our 'll be late for supper ! " As this was a business talk , there was no need for [Harvey]250-harvey to tell [[his]250-harvey mother]1807-his mother about it ; and [Cheyne]250-harvey naturally took the same point of view . But [Mrs. Cheyne]262-cheyne saw and feared , and was a little jealous . [[Her]262-cheyne boy]2924-her boy , who rode rough - shod over [her]262-cheyne , was gone , and in [his]2924-her boy stead reigned [a keen - faced youth , abnormally silent , who addressed most of [his]2924-her boy conversation to [[his]2924-her boy father]1810-his father]3261-a keen - faced youth , abnormally silent , who addressed most of his conversation to his father . [She]262-cheyne understood it was business , and therefore a matter beyond [[her]262-cheyne premises]3263-her premises . If [she]262-cheyne had any doubts , they were resolved when [Cheyne]262-cheyne went to [Boston]23-boston and brought back a new diamond marquise ring . "[1640-our] What have [you]1640-our two been doing now ? " [she]262-cheyne said , with a weak little smile , as [she]262-cheyne turned it in the light . "[1640-our] Talking - just talking , [Mama]250-harvey ; there 's nothing mean about [Harvey]250-harvey . " There was not . [The boy]1817-the boy had made a treaty on [his]1817-the boy own account . [Railroads]455-railroads , [he]1817-the boy explained gravely , interested [him]1817-the boy as little as lumber , real estate , or mining . What [his]1817-the boy soul yearned after was control of [[his]1817-the boy father]1810-his father 's newly purchased [sailing - ship]3266-sailing - ship . If that could be promised [him]1817-the boy within what [he]1817-the boy conceived to be a reasonable time , [he]1817-the boy , for [his]1817-the boy part , guaranteed diligence and sobriety at college for four or five years . "[250-harvey] It 's a deal , " said [Cheyne]262-cheyne at the last . " But [[his]478-robert beavon wife]1815-his wife was in [the hall]1741-the hall . [They]1754-they heard a low cry , as though a little animal had been hit . "[263-disko] [Harvey]250-harvey announced that [he]250-harvey never felt better in [his]250-harvey life ; but it was not till [he]250-harvey saw the ' [We]1768-we 're Here ' , fresh from [the lumper]1769-the lumper 's hands , at [[Wouverman]420-wouverman 's wharf]2883-wouverman 's wharf , that [he]250-harvey lost [his]250-harvey all - overish feelings in a queer mixture of pride and sorrowfulness . [Other people]1771-other people - [summer boarders]3111-summer boarders and such - like - played about in [cat - boats]1773-cat - boats or looked at [the sea]1855-the sea from pier - heads ; but [he]250-harvey understood things from the inside - more things than [he]250-harvey could begin to think about . None the less , [he]250-harvey could have sat down and howled because [the little schooner]2648-the little schooner was going off . [Mrs. Cheyne]262-cheyne simply cried and cried every step of the way and said most extraordinary things to [Mrs. Troop]484-mrs. troop , who " babied "[484-mrs. troop] [her]262-cheyne till [Dan]260-dan , who had not been " babied "[260-dan] since [he]260-dan was six , whistled aloud . And so [the old crowd - Harvey]1776-the old crowd - harvey felt like [the most ancient of [mariners]1778-mariners]1777-the most ancient of mariners dropped into [the old schooner]1779-the old schooner among [the battered dories]1780-the battered dories , while [Harvey]250-harvey slipped the stern - fast from the pier - head , and [they]1781-they slid [her]262-cheyne along [the wharf]3129-the wharf - side with [their]1781-they hands . [Every one]2820-every one wanted to say so much that [no one]1898-no one said anything in particular . [Harvey]250-harvey bade [Dan]260-dan take care of [Uncle Salters]276-uncle salters 's sea - boots and [Penn]284-penn 's dory - anchor , and [Long Jack]273-long jack entreated [Harvey]250-harvey to remember [his]250-harvey lessons in seamanship ; but the jokes fell flat in the presence of [the two women]1785-the two women , and it is hard to be funny with green harbour - water widening between [good friends]1786-good friends . "[484-mrs. troop] Now it was a few years later , and upon [the other edge of [America]22-america]1789-the other edge of america , that [a young man]1790-a young man came through the clammy sea fog up [a windy street which is flanked with most expensive houses built of wood to imitate stone]1791-a windy street which is flanked with most expensive houses built of wood to imitate stone .
